Her business is located within a busy market  and her primary customers are from the nearby town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of clothes. 

Teresia will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes. Teresia's dream and  business goal is to run several retail stores  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a house and expand  her business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa es socia del Bancomunal Urpicha II, tiene 29 años de edad, se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, también vende zapatos y ropa por catálogo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años, es madre de 2 hijos, esta muy agradecida por todo lo que FINCA Perú le ha ayudado tanto en la educación de sus hijos como en la compra de muebles para su hogar y a tener una mejor vida, su economía ha crecido, y ella sabe como administrar su negocio gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Elsa, age 29, is a member of the Communal Bank "Urpicha II". She buys and sells scrap metal, but she also sells shoes and clothing through catalogs. Elsa has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years. She is the mother of two children and is grateful for everything FINCA Peru has helped her with such as providing an education for her children, purchasing furniture for her home, and having a better life. Her income has grown and she knows how to manage her business as a result of the training she received from her Communal Bank.

Elsa is now requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of shoes for her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her business.

loans.name: Maria Gladys

texts.es:
Es una mujer muy entusiasta y sobre todo trabajadora, vive al lado de  su esposo el cual la apoya mucho en todo lo que ella emprende y el cual  trabaja como obrero de construcción, a su lado también viven sus 4 hijos a los cuales ama muchísimo y por los cuales trabaja  mucho por sacarlos adelante, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por ser la cuna de las grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo se caracteriza porque sus pobladores tienen un gran talento en la preparación de platillos ya que tienen una buena sazón. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello le gusta uno de los platos bandera de nuestro país el cual es el riquisisisimo “Ceviche”. Como sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar medicina.

Día a Día Maria se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio de venta de flores en el cementerio de su ciudad, trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 50 clientes diariamente, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y siempre los atiende con mucho afecto.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más flores y mejorar la variedad de su mercadería con lo cual mejorarían sus ingresos y así día a día podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa ya que se derrumbo en el terremoto del año 2007”.
texts.en:
She’s a very enthusiastic lady and above all she’s very hard working.  She lives alongside her husband who supports her in everything she does and who works as a construction worker.  Their four children, whom she loves very much and for whom she works hard to get ahead, also live with them.  Her house is located in the city of Chincha, a city characterized as being the crib of great Peruvian sports.  It’s also characterized by its residents who have great talent in making good seasoned dishes.  Like a good Peruvian woman she enjoys the food typical of our country, such as the delicious Ceviche.  Like her parents before her, she doesn’t have many financial resources and she was only able to get a junior high school education, but she would have liked to have been able to study medicine.

Maria rises early each day to open her cemetery flower business.  She works 12 hours a day and can serve up to 50 customers daily.  She believes that her business is doing well because she’s very friendly with the customers and always serves them with great attention.

Maria is very grateful for the Kiva loans and thanks to the support she’ll be able to buy more flowers and increase the variety of her merchandise, which will improve her income.  This way she can work daily toward realizing her greatest dream, “To finish rebuilding her home that fell in 2007 after the earthquake.”

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: El Sr. José  soltero, se dedica  al comercio de plásticos desde hace ocho años, el Sr. José es una persona joven trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio, el vende en una de las ferias mas populosas de la Ciudad de El alto,  donde le va muy bien, ya que mucha gente compra sus productos que generalmente son de uso de  domestico como platos vasos y jarras de plástico el Sr. José  es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superación con deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida y de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. José is single and has been selling plastic goods for eight years. He is a hardworking young man who is pleased and grateful to Emprender for giving him the opportunity to grow his business. José sells at one of the busiest fairs in the city of El Alto and has done very well. Many people buy his products for household use, such as plates, glasses, and pitchers made of plastic.

Sr. José is a hardworking individual who wants to succeed so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his entire family.

loans.use: to buy pitchers, plates, and other plastic goods.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a resident of the Nkubu area in Central Kenya where she has been active in farming for 15 years. Currently she produces coffee, maize, beans, bananas, and other items. She is 50 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 18 and 13. 

Lydiah has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says farming has been the main source of income for her family. She plans to venture into poultry-keeping as well in the future.

Lydia laments of high costs of farm inputs as the main challenge for her business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sincérité2 Plus Group

texts.en:
Mavuzi is the chairman of a community bank named “Sincérité Plus,” which is composed of 28 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Mavuzi is 27 years old and single. He runs a telephone booth. He started his business in 2006 with a beginning capital of 50 USD. With hard work and determination, his business prospered. Mavuzi’s business is located in the west of the city of Kinshasa. With the next loan, he intends to purchase more prepaid cards and increase the inventory in order to add to his working capital. He makes about 120 USD profit each week. His ambition is to become a primary card provider in his area. Mavuzi is the father of two children, ages 1 and 3.

loans.use: to purchase more prepaid phone cards

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dieu Vivant Plus Group

texts.en:
Brigitte is a leader of the community bank named “Dieu Vivant Plus,” which is composed of 10 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Brigitte is 48 years old, married, and has two adult children who are students. She sells smoked fish in the mid-western area of Kinshasa, which she has been doing since 1998. Through her sales, she earns about $140 per week. 

Brigitte plans to use the loan to purchase bags of smoked fish to resell in order to increase her income. She is a trustworthy client of HOPE DRC, having received and repaid eight loans. In the future, she hopes to become a fish provider in her area.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish to sell.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano” se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 16 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción. Todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas y además de eso hacen actividades juntas para poder salir adelante. 
Nelly es parte del grupo, y ella misma se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo poder ayudar a su familia. Se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de bebidas, en lo que le está yendo muy bien, ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos y personas de otras zonas vienen a comprar de ella. 
Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma ayudar a toda su familia. Es en vistas a este objetivo que ella solicita el crédito, ya que desea abastecer su negocio con más bebidas, y de esa forma ofrecer mayor calidad y variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee named "San Cayetano" is in its third loan cycle with the Women's Program of Fundación Paraguaya. There are 16 members from the District of Asunción. All of them engage in productive activities and work together so that they can move forward.

Nelly is a member of this group. She defines herself as a hardworking and enterprising person who wants to move forward and help her family through her work. Nelly sells all types of beverages and has done very well in this business. Most of the customers who purchase from her are neighbors and people who live in other areas. Her goal is to continue growing so that she can help her entire family. The intended use of the loan she requested is to restock her business with more beverages. This will enable her to provide better quality and greater variety for her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Sylvia has a business selling new clothes.   She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sylvia sells her products in a shop, retail.  

Sylvia has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of new clothes. The main business challenges for Sylvia   include increasing prices of clothes and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also buy a plot of land and build her own house. 

Sylvia lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent,   food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of new clothes

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr:
Ayaovi est une femme âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée å un pasteur. Elle n’a pas d’enfant.
Ayaovi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2011. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques et des habits pour tous clients dans la ville. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le manque de fonds de roulement.
Ayaovi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques et des habits. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ayaovi voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayaovi is a 45 year old woman. She is married to a church leader. She doesn't have any children. 
Ayaovi has been working as a retailer since 2011. She sells cosmetics and clothes for all her customers in the town. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her main difficulty is a lack of working capital.
Ayaovi is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cosmetics and clothes. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, Ayaovi would like to open a shop. She says that she plans to use the profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's group is comprised of 4 hardworking women. Mary is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kinoni in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past year, Mary has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells soft drinks like soda and passion fruit. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and take care of her family. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to start a retail shop and a cloth business. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mary's future prospects by helping her to manage her financial development.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en:
Faafetai is a 32-year-old married woman. She owns and operates a business selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women). She has one year of experience in this business. Faafetai needs a loan of 1000 WST to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She plans to use the profits from her sales (estimated to be 450 tala per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2012, Faafetai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Faafetai's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials to make lavalavas (Samoan sarongs)

loans.name: Odeliza

texts.en: Odeliza is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Odeliza has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, cereal, shampoo, soap and beverages. Odeliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Odeliza hopes to improve her business to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, cereal, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Corina

texts.es: Corina es una emprendedora que se le ha apoyado en el financiamiento en la compra de productos para la pulpería y poder invertir en el negocio en la compra de productos . Esta emprendedora ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, ene cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y deseos de superación. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos como granos básicos, aceite, detergente, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Corina is an entrepreneur who has been helped by financing to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store and to be able to invest in the business buying products.  This entrepreneur has been working with Fundación León 2000 and has shown herself to be a responsible person who wants to improve.  She is currently asking for financing to buy products like basic grain, oil and detergent, among other products.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es: Sebastiana es socia del Bancomunal Urpicha II, tiene 44 años de edad, se dedica  a la venta de condimentos.Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 17 años,ella ama a FINCA Perú, se siente como en casa, está muy agradecida por todo el apoyo que le brindan porque gracias a eso pudo progresar junto a sus hijos, y las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le ayudaron a ser mejor madre,esposa y a valorarse como mujer. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de condimentos,especias,canela,orégano para su negocio.
texts.en: Sebastiana’s a member of the “Urpicha II” communal bank.  She’s 44 years old and is a spice seller.  She’s been a member of Finca Perú for 17 years.  She loves Finca Perú because she feels at home there.  She’s very grateful for all the support they’ve given her because thanks to it she was able to make progress alongside her children and the training she got from her communal bank helped her be a better mother and a better wife and to value herself as a woman.  The loan she’s asking for now is to buy condiments, spices, cinnamon and oregano for her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments, spices, cinnamon, oregano.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 60-year-old married woman. She has 8 children with ages ranging from 18 to 41 years. She describes herself to be determined and diligent. She operates a general stall  where she sells items such as socks, soap, towels, clothes,etc. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located in a busy market near a bus station  and her primary customers are townspeople. 

Ann describes her biggest business challenge to be delay of payments from customers. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase towels and socks. Her business goal is to venture into a clothes retail store  within 5 years. 

Ann hopes that in the future her business will generate profits which she anticipates using for family financial needs  and expanding the business.

loans.use: to purchase more towels and socks.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Originally from Peru, Jessica now lives in Florida where she has been a practicing dentist for over 5 years. Until now, Jessica has been privately contracted and hired by practices to work within their facilities.  However, with the assistance of this loan Jessica will be one step closer to achieving her dream:  opening her own private practice. Jessica has a passion for her work and wants to continue to learn and perfect her skills to be the best that she can be in her field. Jessica has a natural knack at making a name for her in this very competitive field, she engages with her clients and build trust easily. She has created a loyal following of clients that she hopes will accompany her to her private practice when it is established. Jessica would like to use this loan to do three things: continue her education by attending educational seminars on dentistry, create a new marketing strategy, and to purchase oral imaging software.

loans.use: to attend educational seminars, create a new marketing strategy,  and purchase oral imaging software.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe founded her event planning and floral business in 2005, but has had an entrepreneurial drive her whole life. Fe's uncle was a local champion boxer. Her first experience in organizing and event planning came through promoting his fights and organizing receptions after them. She soon knew that she could excel in this work and opened her own business. Her business came to be very well recognized in the local community, as well as internationally. 

Fe now employs 5 people, but is looking to expand more within the United States. Fe says that the greatest achievement in her life has been the opportunity that she has had to provide for herself and her son as a single mother through ownership of her own business. She would like to begin her marketing campaign through mass social and material marketing.  This loan would go towards her national marketing campaign throughout the United States and towards further expanding her business.

loans.use: to begin a national marketing campaign.

loans.name: Victoria Lidia

texts.es: La señorita Victoria tiene 27 años y es Soltera, ella se dedica a la   venta de verduras en un mercado de la zona,  ella vive en la zona de Ovejuyo, este préstamo es la primera secuencia de su crédito dentro de la institución, Victoria utilizara este préstamo para compra de verduras por mayor para incrementar la mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes,  Victoria enfrenta retos en su negocio que la de ampliar su  negocio, y utilizara los beneficios del  crédito  para apertura de salón de belleza ya que Victoria es peinadora y con el tiempo desea tener su propio salón de belleza, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, ya que con esta actividad de venta de verduras pago sus estudios para peinadora y pronto desea abrir su salon de belleza.
texts.en:
Victoria is twenty-seven years old and single. She makes her living selling vegetables in a regional market. She lives in the Ovejuyo region. This loan is her first loan cycle with this organization. Victoria will use this loan to buy vegetables, in large part to increase the merchandise she has to offer her clients. Victoria faces challenges in her business including this expansion of it.

She will use the profits from this loan to open a beauty salon, since Victoria is a hairdresser, and in time would like to have her own beauty salon. She is happy and grateful to the organization for the support provided, since this business of selling vegetables pays for her studies to become a hairdresser.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables that are in season

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Maribel tiene 39 años no es casada pero convive con su pareja con el cual tiene  2 hijos que son 3 y 6, ella se dedica a la  venta de golosinas y material didáctico para niños en la zona los Olivos,  Este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro  de la institución, la Sra.  Maribel  utilizara este préstamo para capital de trabajo para compra de golosinas y material didáctico para surtir su tienda,  la razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de productos y material didáctico para ofrecer a sus clientes, la Sra. Maribel  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, problemas sociales y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su negocio y comprar productos, su deseo  para su negocio es tener un puesto abastecido en un mercado popular, la Sra. Maribel es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Maribel is 39 years old, isn’t married, but lives with her partner with whom she has two children who are 3 and 6 years old.  She sells snacks and learning materials for children in the Los Olivos zone.  This loan is her third sequence in the institution.

Maribel will use the loan as working capital to buy snacks and learning materials to stock her store.  The reason for requesting the loan is that she lacks products and learning materials to offer her customers.

Maribel faces the challenges of competition and societal problems and will use the profits to improve the business and to buy products.  Her wish for her business is to have it in a well-stocked stand in a popular market.  Maribel is a very hardworking person and she feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy teaching supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her baby's delivery.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El sr. Pablo esta solicitando credito para poder ampliar su casa ya que sus hijas estan creciendo y demandan independencia en habitaciones razon por la cual esta acudiendo con nosotros para que lo apoyemos y poder empezar con la costruccion de la recamara de sus hijas.
El sr. Pablo no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar el material  
Solicita el préstamo ya que tiene que comprar el block, cemento, arena y varilla.
texts.en: Pablo is asking for the loan in order to enlarge his house because his children are growing and need their own bedrooms which is why he’s calling on us to help him so that he can start building a bedroom for his daughters.  Pablo does not have enough money to buy the materials and is asking for the loan because he needs to buy concrete blocks, cement, rebar and sand.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer con mucho punche como decimos en Perú, es decir con mucha fuerza y sobre todo perseverancia, vive al lado de sus 2 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y a los que ha sacado a delante sola ya que el padre de sus hijos se separo de ella y Victoria tuvo que convertirse en madre y padre para ellos, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por ser visitada por infinidad de turistas que desean conocer “La laguna de Huacachina”, asimismo es una ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de esparrago, algodón y uva. Cuando Victoria tiene u tiempo libre le gusta cocinar en especial preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”.

Día Día Victoria  trabaja en su negocio de venta de cosméticos, ella trabaja alrededor de 6 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 5 clientes en el día,  también trabaja vendiendo empanadas, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable, carismática y sobre todo porque siempre agradece a Dios ya que siempre easta con ella en las buenas y malas.

Victoria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como cosméticos y productos de belleza, así podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño.” Tener su restaurante”.
texts.en:
Victoria is a woman with lots of ‘punche,’ like we say here in Perú, that is, with much strength and above all, perseverance.  She lives with her two children who are adults and who she’s raised by herself since the father of her children separated from her and Victoria had to become both mother and father for them.  

Her house is located in the city of Ica, a city noted for having hot weather all year and for being visited by an infinite number of tourists that want to get to know the Huacachina Lagoon.  It’s also a city noted for agriculture, especially asparagus and grape growing.  When Victoria has any free time she likes to cook and especially to prepare one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Arroz con Pollo,” [Chicken with Rice].

Day to day Victoria works at her business selling cosmetics.  She works about 6 hours daily and can see up to five customers per day.  She also works selling turnovers.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s very kind, charismatic and above all because she’s always grateful to 
God Who is with her in good times and in bad.

Victoria is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy more merchandise like cosmetics and beauty products for her business so that she can have more variety of products and thus improve her income which will make it possible for her to continue working and striving toward her great dream:  “To have a restaurant.”

loans.use: to buy beauty products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sainte Cathérine Plus Group

texts.en:
Sainte Cathérine Plus is a community bank made up of 10 members. The chairwoman is Jeannette. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC. 

Jeannette sells potatoes. She began her business in 1989. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making it thrive, thanks to the accumulated profits and different loans she received from HOPE DRC. Jeannette is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having 12 times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of potatoes with her next loan by buying some sacks and reselling them at profit. Her business brings in US $30 of profit each week. Her ambition is to someday diversify her activity by opening a general store in her environment. Jeannette is 43 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children whose ages range between 10 and 20 years old. One of them attends school.

loans.use: to increase the stock of potatoes and resell for a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nouvelle Jérusalem Plus Group

texts.en:
Richard, aged 46, is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Nouvelle Jérusalem Plus”. It is composed of 8 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Richard has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2004. He sells beverages. His business is located to the north-east of Kinshasa. He is working hard to develop his business which is supporting his family. The loan he will obtain next will be used to buy more crates of drinks to resell retail with the goal of increasing his profits. His business generates a profit of about $60 per week. 

Richard’s ambition is to become a beverage provider in his area and open a general store. He is married and the father of three children. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his business by buying crates of beverages to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Andrew, who is in  his early 30s, is a widower with two children who are still going to school.  He has been selling water, sodas, juice and chips for four years now.  He works from 10.00 am to 11.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to build a second room, fill in the missing items in his kiosk, and cover household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more sodas, juice, and water to resell and a sack of Irish potatoes for making chips. His dream is to one day be able to build a third room.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Machimbo" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sodas, juice, water and a sack of Irish potatoes for chips.

loans.name: Prodiges Plus Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is the leader of the community bank named “Prodiges Plus”. It is composed of 26 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Emmanuel has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2010. He runs a general store to the northeast of Kinshasa. He works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a large store in his environment. He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that earns him $60 per week. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying cans, sacks of rice, sugar, and milk and reselling them at a profit. 36 years old, Emmanuel is married and the father of two children aged 5 days and 3 years old.

loans.use: to increase the store's stock by buying cans, sacks of rice, sugar, and milk and reselling them at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Takku Liggey Kanda Fodé Bayo  2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Takku Liggey Kanda Fodé Bayo 2 est un groupe de solidarité composé de cinq femmes toutes mariées.Elles mènent des activités de commerce de tissus, de tissu teints, de chaussures pour femmes et d'autres articles de beauté. Il parviennent à générer des revenus qui leur permettent de subvenir à leurs propres besoins. Elles sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour renforcer leur fonds de commerce en achetant des sacs et des tissus. Elles ambitionnent de s'approvisionner plus tard dans les pays environnants ou les prix sont plus abordables.
texts.en: Takku Liggey Kanda Fodé Bayo 2 is a solidarity group made up of five married women. The are able to create income that allows them to meet their own needs. The women are asking for a loan of 500,000 francs to increase their working capital by purchasing bags and fabric. Their goal is to obtain their supplies, in the future, in neighboring countries where prices are lower.

loans.use: to buy bags and fabric.

loans.name: Carmen Jimena

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen tiene 21 años no esta casada pero convive con su pareja con el que tiene un hijo que es de la edad de 3 años, ella se dedica a la  venta de tamales, de pollo y  soda su puesto de venta se encuentra en la localidad de  Pedro Lorenzo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia que  ha tomado dentro de la institución, La Sra. Carmen  utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus tamales de pollo y también compra de sodas por mayor y a si de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Carmen enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y  utilizara los beneficios del crédito  para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, su deseo para su negocio es ser una de las mejores vendedoras y tener mas clientela para mejorar sus ingresos.en la foto se encuentra con su pareja y su hijito de fondo y preparando sus tamales.
texts.en: Carmen, 21, isn’t married but lives with her partner with whom she has a son who is 3 years old.  She sells chicken tamales and soft-drinks.  Her sales stand is located in Pedro Lorenzo.  The loan is the first sequence she’s taken with the institution.  Carmen will use this loan to buy ingredients to make chicken tamales and will also buy soft-drinks at wholesale in order to increase working capital.  The challenge Carmen faces in her business is to rise out of poverty and she’ll use the benefits from the loan to improve her and her family’s quality of life.  Her wish for her business is to become one of the best sellers and to have more customers to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make chicken tamales.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 39 años y es separada con 3 hijos que son de las edades de  17,12 y 8 años, se dedica  a la venta de repuestos de automóviles, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona 16 de julio, en la feria mas populosa de la ciudad de El Alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Martha va a utilizar  este préstamo para  la compra de repuestos de automóviles por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta y de esta manera ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, y así generar mayores ingresos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Martha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar en su negocio y  utilizara los beneficios en aumentar su capital de trabajo y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Martha, 39, is separated; she has three children who are 17, 12 and 8 years old.  She sells auto spare parts in a stand in the 16 de Julio zone, the most crowded street fair in the city of El Alto.  This loan is her first sequence within the institution.  Martha will use the loan to buy auto spare parts at wholesale to stock her stand to offer a wider variety of products to her customers and thus generate higher income.  Her reason for asking for the loan is lack of capital.  Martha facts challenges in her business which are to improve it.  She will use profits to increase her working capital and to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts at wholesale

loans.name: Familiar Cristiano Group

texts.es: Doña Yolanda es miembro del Grupo Solidario Familiar Cristiano, tiene 68 años de edad, es madre soltera de 8 hijos, ella vive con una de sus hijas y es la que le ayuda a trabajar, ella reside en la comunidad de  Guayabillas y desde hace 40 años se dedica a la compra de cerdos para destazo, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron  trabajar, ella es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora ya que con este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Yolanda comenzó a comprar cerdos con lo poco que le daban sus hijos, y con los prestamos que ha solicitado en FAMA a logrado incrementar su negocio, no tiene problemas en las ventas porque tiene buena demanda. El préstamo que doña Yolanda solicita lo necesita para la compra de cerdos. Uno de los inconvenientes que presenta es que en algunas ocasiones no encuentra cerdos para destazar o no tiene el dinero suficiente para comprar cerdos. Doña Yolanda tiene más de quince ciclos de trabajar con FAMA y está muy agradecida con el apoyo que ha recibido, ella ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the “Familiar Cristiano” communal bank.  She’s 68 years old and a single mother of 8 children.  She lives with one of her daughters who is the one that helps her work.  She lives in the community of Guayabillas and for the last 40 years has worked buying pigs to butcher.  Her parents taught her how to work since she was little.  She is a very tenacious, hardworking person; she has managed to support her family through this business.

Yolanda started to buy pigs with the little help she got from her children and with loans from FAMA has managed to enlarge the business.  She has no problems with sales because demand is good.  The loan Yolanda needs it to buy pigs.  One of the inconveniences she faces it that sometimes she does not find any pigs to butcher or does not have enough money to buy pigs.  Yolanda has been working with FAMA for more than 15 cycles and she is very grateful for the support she’s gotten; she’s made her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Juana Toribia

texts.es:
La señora Juana Toribia es casada, tiene 44 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos los cuales 2 están estudiando, se dedica a la sastrería,  a la confección de telas, camisa, pantalones y delantales, lleva ya 4 años de experiencia en este trabajo.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo para la compra de telas típicos de diferentes colores, para aumentar su producción de delantales típicos. Espera mejorar su trabajo con la ampliación de capital que está haciendo.
texts.en:
Juana Toribia, 44, is married.  She never had the opportunity to go to school.  She has four children two of which are attending school.  She’s a tailor; she makes fabric, shirts, pants and aprons.  She has four years’ experience in this work.

She decided to request a loan that will help her expand her working capital buying traditional fabrics in assorted colors to increase production of traditional aprons.  She hopes to improve her work with this increase in capital she’s doing.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Señor De Luren Group

texts.es: Un grupo de mujeres con una sola finalidad, tener éxito en sus negocios y salir siempre adelante, así son las integrantes de la alcancía comunal "Señor de Luren" conformado por 9 integrantes hace ya más de 7 años. Lo integran personas con iniciativa al cambio y al progreso como la señora Zoila de 57 años de edad y madre de tres hijos de los cuales son mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de  productos de belleza y ventas de bebidas hace más de 10 años con el cual ha podido implementar su hogar y darle a sus hijos la educación y los cuidados requeridos junto a su esposo, en el futuro le gustaría comprase un carro y hacerlo trabajar en servicio de taxi. Con el reciente préstamo comprara más productos de belleza para la temporada. Como la señora Zoila todas las integrantes de la alcancía comunal "Señor de Luren" son mujeres  emprendedoras y trabajadoras con el único objetivo de triunfar por el bienestar de ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
A group of enterprising women with the only goal of being successful in their businesses and always get ahead is the make-up of the “Señor de Luren” communal bank.  It has 9 members and has been in operation for more than 7 years.  It’s made up of people with initiative for change and progress like Zoila, 57.  She’s the mother of three children who are now adults.  

She has sold beauty products and beverages for more than 10 years and this has made it possible for her to furnish her home and give her children an education and the required care together with her husband.  In the future she’d like to buy a car and put it to work as a taxi.  With this most recent loan she will buy more beauty products for the season.  

Like Zoila, all the members of the “Señor de Luren” communal bank are enterprising, tenacious women whose only goal is to be successful for their and their families’ wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Adinofex Plus Group

texts.en:
Adinofex Plus is a group of 16 owners of small businesses chaired by Yves. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Yves, married and aged 41, operates a general store in an area located mid-west of the capital city of Kinshasa. He has been in business since 2001. He has acquired solid experience in this area. Yves has already used six Hope loans (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) to finance the expanding of his inventory and he paid them back correctly. 

Due to the high demand in his community, he intends with the next loan to buy more goods for resale in order to meet clients' demand and generate additional profit. This will help him to achieve his plans to grow the business. It brings in a profit of US$122 per week. Yves’s ambition is to expand his store further. He is engaged. He is the father of three children whose ages are between 10 and 14 years old. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for his store for resale at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Alex Gerardo

texts.es:
Alex es un joven de 26 años el cual vive junto a sus padres en la ciudd de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos que recibe muchas visitas el cual son las islas Ballestas y el candelabro de paracas, también es una ciudad cuya actividad principal es la pesca y la agricultura. Alex es un joven humilde con la ayuda de sus padres y algunos amigos el logro iniciar su negocio de crianza y venta de pollos,  al principio le fue un poco difícil, pero poco a poco fue saliendo adelante, su negocio ya lleva mas de un año y con ello el puede colaborar con los gastos del hogar y apoyar de esa manera a sus padres ya que ellos también lo han apoyado.

Alex está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas aves, alimentos balanceado, medicamentos, entre otros, los cuales son necesarios en las primeras 6 semanas del crecimiento de las aves, así como también  construir un nuevo corral para la crianza de las aves, lo que le permitirá tener aves en buen estado para la venta y mejorar sus ingresos, así podrá seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres y terminar de estudiar”.
texts.en:
Alex, 26, is a young man living with his parents in the city of Pisco, a city noted for having one of the most visited tourist attractions:  the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabrum.  It’s also a city whose main activity is fishing and agriculture.   

Alex is a humble young man who with help from his parents and some friends managed to start a business of raising and selling chickens.  At the beginning it was a bit difficult but gradually he started to get ahead.  His business has been in operation for more than a year now and he’s able to contribute to his home through it and support his parents like they’ve supported him.

Alex is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given him he will be able to buy more fowl, nutritionally balanced feed and medicine, among others, that are needed in the first six weeks of their growth.  He will also build a new corral for raising fowl that will make it possible for him to have them in good condition for sale and to improve his income so that he can continue striving toward reaching his great dream:  “To give his parents a better quality of life and to complete his studies.”

loans.use: to buy fowl, medicine, feed and to build a corral.

loans.name: Bokoli Plus Group

texts.en:
Bokoli Plus is a Community Bank made up of 13 members whose chairwoman is Nono. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC. 

Nono’s main activity is selling sacks of sugar and milk. She began her business in 1995. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits and different loans she received from HOPE DRC. Nono is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having eight times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying some sacks of sugar and milk and reselling them at profit. 

Nono's business brings in US$170 in profit each week. Her dream is to someday open a big sugar and milk facility in her area. Nono is 38 years old, married and the mother of 6 children, whose ages vary between 1 and 20 years old. Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase her inventory by buying some sacks of sugar and milk and reselling at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is married and the mother of four children, all of whom attend school and two of whom are in high school. For the last year, Rachel has earned a living by running a pre-primary and primary school. She employs five people in the school, and earns a living on the side by running a poultry business and selling fruit. She was introduced to Milango by her sister. who is a member of our organization. She joined to access credit, and is applying for a loan for 41,850 Kenyam shillings to buy textbooks, poultry feed and to finish construction of poultry house. Rachel is happy to be a member of Milango, having purchased school text books from an earlier first loan. Her goal is to own a truck she can use to transport fruits and expand her school. She believes the extra income from this loan will help her provide good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy text books, poultry feed and finish construction of a poultry house.

loans.name: Diana Miriam

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer muy carismática, es madre de un pequeño de 1 añito al que adora mucho y es su alegría y su motor para salir adelante, porque con solo mirarlo se da cuenta de lo mucho que significa para ella y por eso se esfuerza mucho para hacerlo feliz. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva y esparrago. Cuando diana tiene un tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y sobre todo al lado de su bebe ya que lo hace bailar en sus brazos, también le agrada comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “lomo Saltado”.

Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Diana logro iniciar su negocio de venta de Ropa y venta de hamburguesas en su vivienda, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque Dios siempre está con ella.

Diana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio, en especial ropa de dama por campaña de día de la madre y tambien para la compra de baldes de acite, arroz, balde de mostaza y baldes de ketchup, lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos y tener los insumos necesarios para la elaboracion de sus hamburguesas, lo que le permitira mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño: “Tener su propio local”.
texts.en:
Diana is a very charismatic woman; she’s the mother of a little one-year-old who she adores very much and is her joy and motivator to get ahead because by just looking at him she realizes how much he means to her and this is why she strives so hard to make him happy. 

Her house is located in the city of Ica, a city noted for its hot climate all year as well as for agriculture, especially cotton, grapes and asparagus growing.  When Diana has any free time she likes listening to music especially alongside her baby because she makes him dance in her arms.  She also likes to enjoy one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Lomo Saltado.”

With much effort and saving Diana managed to start her business selling clothes and hamburgers at home.  She works about 9 hours daily and can see up to 15 customers per day.  She believes that she does well in her business because God is always with her.

Diana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy merchandise for her business, especially women’s clothes for Mother’s Day and also to buy bottles of oil, rice, jars of mustard and ketchup that will make it possible for her to have a greater variety of products and to have the ingredients necessary to make hamburgers leading to improved income to continue striving toward making her dream a reality: “To have her own locale.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business (clothes and ingredients for hamburgers).

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy es un hombre de 36 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive en el caserío Valle Nuevo, en el distrito de Mochumí, es una zona rural a 25 minutos de Lambayeque.
La actividad comercial es crianza de  animales. Cónyuge se encarga del cuidado de animales.Cuenta con experiencia de 10 años en dicha actividad. El negocio de animales ubicado en su propio domicilio  cuenta con clientela fija como comerciantes de mercados de Chiclayo y alrededores que se muestran interesados por la excelente condición de los animales.
Con el préstamo actual de 2000 nuevos soles tiene pensado ampliar corrales para la crianza y comprar alimento para engorde de animales menores y ganado porcino. AdemásPercy desea invertir en arreglos de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Percy is a 36-year-old man, lives with his partner, and has 2 dependent children. He lives in the town of Valle Nuevo, in Mochumi district. It is a rural zone 25 minutes from Lambayeque.

His business is raising animals. His spouse is in charge of caring for the animals. He has 10 years of experience in said work. The animal raising business is located in their own home. It depends on regular customers such as merchants in markets from Chiclayo and the surrounding areas which show interest because of the excellent condition of the animals.

With the current loan of 2000 nuevos soles he has it in mind to expand the corrals for raising animals and to buy feed to fatten up the younger animals and the hogs. Furthermore Percy wishes to invest in home repairs.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Molende Plus Group

texts.en:
Sylvie is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Molende Plus.” It is composed of 11 members, who are united in solidarity to develop their businesses with the help of Kiva loans.

Sylvie has been in the small business world since 1993. She started her first business operating a restaurant. After some years, she decided to change industries due to profitability. Sylvie quickly stabilized her new second-hand clothing business through hard work, determination, good management, and savings. She started with one bundle of second-hand clothing and is up to ten bundles today. Sylvie sells at a market in Kinshasa, and her business makes $60 per week. Sylvie has already obtained and correctly repaid twenty loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying 4 bundles of second-hand clothing and reselling them at a profit. 

Sylvie is confident with her business and is determined to someday be a second-hand clothing importer for markets in the DRC in general, especially in Kinshasa. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four children between the ages 3 and 14, three of whom attend school.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bundles of second hand clothing to resell at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce lives in the coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She is single and runs a transport business which has been in operation for five months. Besides this, she also sells clothes and is employed full time. She was introduced to Milango by one of her friends and is applying for a loan for 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy items to sell in her boutique, including new clothes, handbags and other items. This is because during the rainy season, there is less motorcycle transport. Joyce has therefore decided to stock up in preparation for this. Her main challenge is that by being employed full time, there is little time to supervise her other businesses. Despite this, Joyce is optimistic that she can develop the businesses to a higher level for her future good. This will allow her to own more than one motorcycle and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her boutique.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 49 years old and lives in Culpan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children.

Fe has a general store that sells a variety of products such as soft drinks, noodles, shampoo, etc. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business and help her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 45 years old and lives in Molatuhan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is single.

Nelson has a general store business that sells a variety of products such as soup, canned goods, noodles, sugar, etc. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 14,950 to purchase more stocks for his general store.

Nelson has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, he hopes to have his own family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for his general store

loans.name: Marvin  Manuel

texts.es: Marvin es un joven originario de León, casado, de 29 años de edad, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de restaurante en el que cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, su mama siempre ha tenido negocios que lo han hecho crecer en el ámbito comercial desde los 19 años luego decide independizarse poniendo su propio negocio de restaurante donde es  apoyado por su mama, su expectativa es mantener  su negocio, darle mejores condiciones para una buena presentación que llame la atención de los clientes y mantenerlo siempre surtido con los productos que tienen mas demanda en su comunidad. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de marisco, gaseosa y jugos ya que este crédito le ayudara porque podrá comprar más productos para surtir su negocio al igual que tendrá mas materia prima para la elaboración de las comidas que ofrece en su restaurante ya que se acerca la época de verano donde las ventas son muy buenas por los turistas que visitan su restaurante, como planes futuro espera seguir adelante con su negocio invirtiéndole para tener mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Marvin is a young man originally from León, married and is 29 years old. His commercial business is a restaurant and he has 10 years experience. His mother always has had businesses that have grown in the commercial field, and when he was 19 years old he decided to become independent starting his own restaurant with the help of his mother. His expectation is to  maintain his business, improving it in order to make a good appearance for the sake of his clients and always being well supplied with the products that are in highest demand in his community.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy seafood, soft drinks and juices and this loan will help him because he will buy more products in order to supply his business and at the same time he will have more of the raw materials used making meals that he offers in his restaurant. Summer season is approaching when sales are very good because the tourists visit his restaurant. Regarding future plans, he hopes to continue moving forward with his business altering it in order to have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy seafood, soft drinks and juices

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex es un joven muy trabajador, junto a su esposa tiene 2 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y trabaja muy duro por darle una vida feliz, su vivienda se ubica  en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva y esparrago. Como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platillos favoritos son los riquísimos tallarines rojos con papa a la huancaína. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar “Ingeniería mecánica”.

Día a día Alex trabaja en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día  y puede atender hasta 35 clientes diariamente, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y responsable.

Alex está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su mototaxi y también  realizar el techado de su vivienda, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingreso y darle una mejor calidad de vida y seguridad a su familia, así el podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Alex is a very hardworking young man.  He works very hard to give his wife and two children who he loves very much a better life.  His house is located in the city of Ica, a city noted for having hot weather all year and for its agriculture, especially cotton, grapes and asparagus growing.  Like all good Peruvians, he very much enjoys our country’s traditional dishes.  One of his favorites is the very delicious “Tallarines Rojos con Papa a la Huancaína.”  Because of his parents’ low economic resources, he was only able to study up to fifth year of secondary school but he would have liked to have studied mechanical engineering.

Alex works day to day as a mototaxi driver.  He works about 10 hours daily and can take care of up to 35 customers per day.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s very dedicated and responsible.

Alex is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to service his mototaxi and also install a roof on his house which will allow him to improve his income and give his family better security and better quality of life so that he can continue working toward making his greatest dream come true:  “To finish building his house.”

loans.use: to service his vehicle and to roof his house.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is 36 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. He is married and has three children.

Edgardo has a restaurant business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a new loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for his restaurant business.

Edgardo has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, he hopes to improve his living situation, to be able to support his family especially in their daily basic needs, and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for his restaurant business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 44 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela. She is married and has three children.

Jennifer is a farmer who grows crops and vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Jennifer has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase fertilizer for her farming business. 

Jennifer has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farming business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49 years old and married with four children. She lives in the Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

For 11 years, Virginia has been selling fish to earn a living and she earns PHP 2,000 monthly. Virginia been a member of GDMPC since 2009. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,449 to repair her fishing nets. In the future, Virginia hopes that her business will provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to repair her fishing nets.

loans.name: Jessielyn's Group

texts.en: Jessielyn earns a living by selling cosmetics made by Natasha and Avon. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from her work. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more of these products to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for almost a year and hopes to expand her business in the future. She leads a two-person loan group. Although members borrow as a group, each person has her own business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old, married, and has four children.  She is from Maquilao, Tangub City. Maricel manages a vegetables gardening business, which she has been doing for seven years.  She earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Maricel joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan for 11,824 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay, 32, is single and resides with her mother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store and a business of buying rice to resell for more than two years, earning approximately US $8 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Lay is requesting a loan of US $1,500 to raise capital for her business to purchase more rice to resell. This purchase would enable her to earn more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to raise capital for her business to purchase more rice to resell.

loans.name: Charlott

texts.en:
Shoes, purses, jewelry, tops and sundresses are some of the items found at Plush Boutique, a women's retail store in Oakdale, LA. 

Owned by 62-year-old, Charlott, her business differs from others within the area as she fills her inventory with items, one in each size, which she finds in cities like Houston and San Antonio. 

Charlott jumped at the opportunity to create her own business. "It was strange at first, " she said as she was constantly looking for someone else to assist her within her 30 years of sales experience. "It took a bit of getting used to." 

In the future, she plans to hire employees, but for now, "I just plan to make this location grow," Charlott said. 

Other than requesting a loan from a bank, Charlott went straight to ACCION Texas Inc. after attending a Louisiana Business Incubation Association, or LBIA, conference, she said. 

She said the loan will help her business grow by allowing her to have more inventory, which will then result in more traffic. Without it, she said, "I would have to pay out of pocket and ask family to help me out." 

At the moment, she does not have a social media page but is working to gain more customers and another computer, local newspaper ads, and business cards.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 35 years old. Ritchel is married and has four children. Ritchel has a general store. Ritchel has been in her business for seven years and earns 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ritchel joined GDMPC. Ritchel is requesting a loan of 12,132 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is 40 years old and is a single entrepreneur.  She lives in Silanga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental and has a flower/gardening production business. She started her business almost five years ago and she earns PHP 2,300 monthly. To improve her business production, she joined GDMPC in 2010.  She is borrowing PHP 5,141 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Before long, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Soth, 53, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling rice for over ten years, earning approximately US $4 per day. Her husband is a policeman who earns about US $5 per day. Two of her children are employed in garment factories. They earn approximately US $6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economic situation, Soth is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more rice to resell. This purchase would enable her to make more profit to support her family.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to resell.

loans.name: Lilibeth's Group

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 41 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children.

Lilibeth has a gasoline retailing business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to be used for purchasing additional volumes of gasoline for retail.

Lilibeth has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, she hopes to build a mini gasoline station. Lilibeth is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase additional volumes of gasoline for resale.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is married and has four children. She is 33 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Mylene sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Mylene has been a member of PMPC for almost three years.  In the future, she hopes to build a dried fish stand.

loans.use: To purchase more different dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sokou

texts.en: Sakou, 33, is married and lives with her mother, her husband and her three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops and selling groceries for over five years, and earns about $10 US a day. Her husband helps her run her business. Due to a lack of funding, she is requesting a loan for $1,200 US to buy a small tractor to till her farmland. This purchase will help her reduce her expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. She also plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a small tractor to till her farmland.

loans.name: Nemisia

texts.en: Nemisia is 57 years old and lives in Dulapo, Oroquieta City. She is widow with four children who earns a living by running a shop where she sells a variety of flowers. She has had this business for 10 years and is requesting a loan to buy more flowers to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for four years and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, 47, resides with her husband and two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for over twenty years, has extensive experience, and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice, vegetables and fattening up cattle.  She earns approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family's livelihood, Sophal is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase piglets to breed in order to resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed in order to resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat, 57, resides with her husband and three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over six years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a chef who earns about $6 per day. Three of her children are employed. They are garment and construction workers. They earn about $12 per day. 

In order to improve her family's living conditions, Nat is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more groceries to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and help her youngest child get a bachelor's degree. Moreover, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes vive en la ciudad de pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus playas hermosas y por sus atractivos turísticos los cuales son el Candelabro de paracas y las Islas ballestas, las cuales reciben a infinidad de turistas por ser lugares hermosos. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear y sobre todo comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Ceviche. Ella estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Administración de Empresas.

Mercedes trabaja en su negocio de alquiler de cuartos y venta de bebidas como cervezas, gaseosas, entre otros, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo respetuosa.

Mercedes está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá terminar de realizar un mantenimiento a uno de los cuartos que alquila, con lo cual dará mas comodidad a los clientes y mejorar sus ingresos para asi seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Construir más cuartos en el segundo piso de su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in the city of Pisco, a city characterized by its warm climate, beautiful beaches, and its tourist attractions which are the Candelabra of Paracas and the Ballestas Islands, which receive an infinite number of tourists for being beautiful places.  When free time is available, she likes to go for a walk and especially to eat one of her favorite dishes which is the rich Ceviche.  She studied up until fifth grade of secondary school, but she would have liked to study Business Administration.

Mercedes works in her business of renting rooms and selling drinks like beer and sodas, among others.  She works about 10 hours a day and can serve up to 20 customers in the day.  She believes that it is going well with her business because she is friendly with the customers and above all respectful.

Mercedes is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help that they have offered her she will be able to finish the maintenance on one of the rooms that she rents, which will provide more comfort to the customers and improve her income so that she can continue working to make her largest dream become reality – "to build more rooms on the second floor of her lodgings".

loans.use: to maintain rooms.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is 26 years old and lives in Purok 5, Villa Consuelo Ozamiz City. He is single. To earn a living, Christopher operates a motorcycle transportation business. He earns 6,000 PHP each month doing this business. He has a requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase one motorcycle. Christopher has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Christopher hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Чурабек уже десять лет как занимается производством газированных напитков. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он берет кредит для приобретения стройматериалов. Он хочет открыть торговую точку рядом со складом.
texts.en: Jurabek has been involved in producing carbonated beverages for ten years.  He is 41 years old, married and has five children.  He is requesting this loan to buy construction materials.  Jurabek wants to open a retail outlet near his storage space.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es: Xiomara es una mujer emprendedora y apasionada al comercio, pues manifiesta ser el negocio su maxima fuente de ingresos para ella poderles brindar a su hermosa familia lo mejor. Hoy en dia sigue contando con el apoyo moral y economico de su señor esposo.Su meta a largo plazo es seguir renovando su negocio, invertir en el de manera que cuando sus clientes le soliciten cualquier producto lo pueda tener dentro de su inventario. Sus ventas incrementaron al inducir mas mercaderia, el cual lo logro con financiamiento que Afodenic le ha otorgado en diez ciclos.Con este su decimo ciclo de credito se propone comprar una variedad de articulos tales como: camisetas, blusas, sandalias, ropa intima de mujer, sandalias de baño, toallas, calsonetas para caballero, sombrillas, short, sillas plasticas para niños, articulos de plasticos entre otros. Agradece a la micro-financiera por el apoyo al crecimiento de su pequeño negocio y al bienestar socio-economico de su familia.
texts.en:
Xiomara is an enterprising woman who is passionate about commerce because she states that her business is the main source of income for her to provide her beautiful family with the best.  Today, she continues having her husband’s moral and economic support.  

Her long-term goal is to continue to renovate her business, to invest in such a way that when her customers request some product she’ll have it in stock.  Her sales increased when she included more merchandise which she was able to do with and Afodenic financing she’s gotten in ten cycles.  

With this tenth cycle of financing, she intends to buy an assortment of articles like: t-shirts, blouses, sandals, women’s lingerie, bath sandals, towels, men’s underwear, umbrellas, shorts, plastic children’s chairs and plastic items, among others.  

She thanks the micro lender for the support it’s given to the growth of her small business and to her family’s socio-economic wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy clothes and other merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Mountain View Group

texts.en:
Arlyn is 33 years old and lives in Upper Locuban, Dumalinao, ZDS. She is married with two children.

Arlyn has a general store that sells different kinds of goods. She had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Arlyn has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Arlyn hopes to expand her retail business.  Arlyn is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Lorgen

texts.en:
Lorgen is married with 2 children. Lorgen is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lorgen is a farmer and she manages their coconut production to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years and every month she earns 2,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 3,496 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

Lorgen has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years. In the future, Lorgen hopes to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Акбар проживает в районе Фархор. Ему 65 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Акбар занимается скотоводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Akbar lives in the Farkhor district.  He is 65 years old, married and has five children.  Akbar is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds livestock for subsequent sale.  He is requesting this loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Parigul

texts.ru: Паригул жительница района Фархор. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она более 20 лет занимается животноводством. В основном Паригул разводит мелко - рогатый скот. Кроме того она занимается шитьем. В этой области она 8 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Parigul is a resident of the Farkhor district.  She is 43 years old, married and has four children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years.  Parigul primarily breeds small livestock.  Besides this, she is involved in sewing.  She has been in this business for eight years.  Parigul is requesting this loan to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: San Carlos Group

texts.es: La Sra. Antonia de 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 aún depende de ella. Se dedica a la venta de zapatillas desde hace más de 20 años y  como segunda actividad se dedica a la confección de chompas desde hace 6 meses. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa y dar educación a sus hijos. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de vestimenta y pago de servicios, mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de alimentación. Ella destinará el crédito para la compra de materiales con los cuales pueda fabricar sus productos (chompas). Antonia pertenece a la alcancía comunal “San Carlos”, el cual esta conformado por 7 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta desde hace 4 meses.
texts.en: Fifty-three-year-old Antonia is married and has three children, one of whom is still her dependent.  She has sold slippers for a living for over 20 years and she has been making sweaters for six months as a second business.  Through her effort and work she has been able to build her home and give her children an education.  Currently, she is using her investment to pay for clothing costs and utilities while her husband covers food expenses.  Her plan for the future is to buy more machines for her business' production.  She used her loan to buy materials to make her products.  Antonia belongs to the San Carlos Communal Bank, which is make up of seven people and of which she has been the president for four months.

loans.use: to buy materials to make sweaters

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 71 years old and lives in Mitazan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow with five children. 

Isabel sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for five (5) years. She requested a loan to buy additional inventory for sale.

Isabel has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Isabel hopes to own a house & lot someday.
