loans.use: to purchase more different dried fish to sell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 66 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 

Merlita has a dressmaking business and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase materials for her dressmaking business. 

Merlita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Merlita hopes to purchase a motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Rustica

texts.en:
Rustica is 50 years old and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 

Rustica has a general store that sells variety of products like soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others.  She has had this business for four (4) years. She requested a loan of 5000 PHP to  purchase more stock for her general store. 

She has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Rustica hopes to own a house & lot someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Victoria Basilia

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer muy humilde y a pesar de sus 60 años, tiene un espíritu de una joven de 20; vive al lado de su esposo, el cual actualmente tiene 70 años y que por motivos de salud dejo de trabajar desde hace ya 3 años y motivo por el cual que Victoria trabaja muy duro para poder salir a delante y sobre todo apoyar a su esposo; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es muy conocido porque allí se encuentra uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual son las Islas Ballestas y el gran candelabro de Paracas. 
 
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y sobre todo el ánimo y el apoyo de sus hijos mayores, decidió tener su negocio de venta de abarrotes; ella se dedica alrededor de 10 horas al día y es que ella se esfuerza mucho ya que a raíz de la enfermedad de su esposo ella es el único sustento de su hogar, por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque se esfuerza mucho por trabajar y sobre todo por salir adelante.

Victoria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ella podrá  comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, fideos, bebidas gaseosas, entre otros, lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y sobre todo mejorar sus ingresos para seguir adelante y poder darle una mejor atención a sus esposo y mejorar su calidad de vida, así ella seguirá día a día luchando para ver realizado su gran sueño:” Ayudar a su esposo”.
texts.en:
Victoria is a very humble woman and in spite of being 60 years old she has the spirit of a 20 year old. She lives alongside her husband, who is 70 years old and due to health reasons three years ago had to stop working. For this reason, Victoria works very hard to be able to get ahead and above all to support her husband. Her house is located in the city of Pisco, a city that is characterized by its warm and welcoming climate. It is also very well known because it is there that one of the most important touristic attractions is found, the Islas Ballestas, as well as the great candleabra of Paracas. 

With much dedication and hard work and above all good humor and the support of her older children, she has decided to have a small grocery store. She dedicates around 10 hours per day; she works so hard because due to her husband's illness she is the only one who is sustaining their household. She believes that her business is going well and it is for this reason that she works so hard to get ahead. 

Victoria is very appreciative of the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she can buy merchandise for her store such as rice, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, and other supplies to be able to get ahead and give better attention to her husband and improve their quality of life. She continues to fight daily so that she can see her dream realized: to help her husband.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, mineral water, milk, sugar, and others

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is from Pantaon, Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old. Crisanta is married and has three children. To make a living, Crisanta plants and harvests corn for sale. 

Crisanta been in her business for 18 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Crisanta joined GDMPC. Crisanta is requesting a loan of 5,398 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to purchase additional seedlings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to purchase additional seedlings.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn, 65, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He and his wife have been involved in growing rice and vegetables and fattening up cattle for over ten years and are successful in their career. Additionally, he runs a grocery store at home to generate more income to support the family. Approximately, he earns USD 14 per day. One of his children is employed in South Korea. He earns about USD 7 per day. 

In order to improve his family’s living conditions, Yorn is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries for resale. This purchase would enable him to earn more profit to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand his grocery store and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale

loans.name: Nay

texts.en:
Nay, 55, is married and resides with his wife and two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He has been employed as a teacher for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. His wife is employed in Thailand. She earns about USD 3 per day. Nay wants to rebuild his present house. 

With this goal in mind, Nay is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase construction materials to rebuild his house. This money will help him provide better living condition for his family. In the future, he would like to help his children get Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild his house

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is married and has five children. She is 58 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Luzminda used her last loan to purchase fertilizer. Her business grew and is thriving. Now, she's requesting a new loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. With hope and faith, she aims to nurture her business further.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is 23 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 5.  In 2005, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the future, Shanti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Costa Pucu Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado costa pucu tiene 18 integrantes, las mismas son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Las mujeres de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas e invirtien sus créditos para el sustento de sus negocios y también para la ayuda de sus familias.
La Sra. Eulalia es una de las integrantes del grupo, cuenta con un pequeña despensa y gracias a la ayudar que recibió varias de la fundación ha podido ir creciendo y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria y salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, comestibles, carnes y demás insumos que son los que más venta tiene y quiere surtirse con ellos. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, `pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The “Costa Puco” committee has 18 members from the city of Caacupé.  The women in this committee have a variety of activities and will use their loans to sustain their businesses and also to help their families.

Eulalia is one of the group members.  She has a small grocery store and thanks to the help she got from the Fundación she has been able to gradually grow and help her family this way.  Her goal is to continue growing as a micro businesswoman and to get ahead.

She is asking for the loan to buy soft-drinks, dairy products, foodstuffs, meats and other supplies that sell the most and she wants to stock up on them.  
She is grateful for the opportunity she’s receiving because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas es el grupo formado por 15 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y con un gran espiritu emprendedor. Ellas dia adia luchan y desean ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y el de sus familias.
La sra. Liz se dedica a la venta de helados de todo tipo y sabores, ella esta casada con el señor Lucio, tiene  4  hijos quienes son su motivo de lucha y de sacrificio.  Liz desea seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder crecer como microempresaria para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de helados de todos los sabores, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma tener mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) is the group formed by 15 women from the city of Luque.  They are very hardworking women with strong drives to get ahead and with great enterprising spirits.  They strive day to day to improve their and their families’ living conditions. 

Liz sells all types and flavors of frozen treats.  She’s married to Lucio and has four children who are the motive behind her struggle and sacrifice. Liz wants to continue working to be able to grow as a micro businesswoman and continue helping her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy frozen treats in all flavors to stock up and have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de la Sra. Maria Lurdes y la Sra. Eulogia, quienes se habían acercado a la Fundación Paraguaya e invitaron a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 19 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días. 
Maria Lurdes se dedica a la venta de crochet que ella misma hace. Diseña todo tipo de cosas, como ser sobrecamas, manteles, prendas y demás. Sus productos son muy aceptados y vendidos,  ya que tiene muchos clientes que siempre le hacen pedidos y compran de ella. Su deseo es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma ir creciendo como microempresaria. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas y demás insumos que necesite para seguir trabajando y haciendo su crochet.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to María Lourdes and Eulogia who had approached Fundación Paraguaya and invited their friends and neighbors from the neighborhood to join in the work to get ahead and improve their lifestyle.  They are 19 hardworking, humble women who must earn their daily sustenance.

María Lourdes sells crocheted items that she makes herself.  She designs all types of items like bedspreads, tablecloths, articles of clothing and others.  Her products are well-received and sell well because she has many customers that always place orders and buy from her.  Her desire is to be able to continue working and growing as a micro businesswoman this way.

She is asking for the loan to buy thread, needles and other supplies she needs to continue working and doing her crocheting.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles and others.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia es de la ciudad de Luque, ella está casada con el Sr. Librado, con quien tiene  2 hijos varones que se encuentran estudiando. Ella se dedica a la enfermería trabajando en ello por varios años, su marido es Militar de carrera, con dos años y no dejando de lado su profesión abrió para su despensa en su casa a lo cual se dedica hace varios años, lo que le ha ayudado a tener ya varios clientes de la zona. Ella comenta que le gustaría que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que pueda ampliar su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, enlatados y demás insumos con los que podrá tener bien surtido su local y ofrecer buena variedad a sus clientes.Ella Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, pues de esta forma podrá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Lidia is from the city of Luque.  She’s married to Librado and they have two boys attending school.  She’s a nurse and has worked in this profession for many years.  Her husband is a career military man.  Two years into it, not neglecting her profession, she opened a store at home that she’s now had for several years which has led to her having many customers in the area.  She comments that she’d like her children to finish their schooling so that she can expand the business.

She’s asking for the loan to buy beverages, foodstuffs, canned goods and other supplies to have her store well-stocked and offer a wide variety of goods to her customers.  She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because she will be able to continue growing this way.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, foodstuffs, canned goods and other supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Talentosas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Talentosas"tiene mas de  1 año de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya,  podemos destacar el gran esfuerzo que hacen todas ellas y que gracias al trabajo en conjunto que están haciendo han podido ayudar a sus familiares a salir adelante. 
Nilsa forma parte del grupo, y ella nos comenta que se dedica al reciclaje de plásticos, latas, cartones y demás. Nos dice que es un trabajo muy agotador, pero que pese a ello está muy orgullosa de lo hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y pobre todo honesto. 
 Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plásticos y catones, para que los pueda vender luego en cantidad y de esa forma tener mayor ganancia. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo por parte de la fundación y de Kiva.
texts.en:
The Committee "Mujeres Talentosas" (Talented Women) was established more than a year ago so that they could work with Fundación Paraguaya. Their efforts deserve to be highlighted since they have worked together to help their families move forward.

Nilsa is a member of the group. She says that she recycles plastics, cans, cardboard, and other materials. Nilsa indicates that her job is quite exhausting, but despite this difficulty, she is very proud of what she does. Her work may be menial, but it is a decent and honest living.

Nilsa is requesting a loan to buy plastics and cardboard so that she can sell them later in large quantities, thus allowing her to generate more income. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy plastics and cardboard to sell.

loans.name: Acosta Ñu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Acosta Ñu es de la ciudad de Concepción, está integrado por 19 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Son mujeres muy luchadoras y con ganas de salir adelante. Luchan diariamente para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para su día a día. 
Una de las miembros es la Sra.  Trifina, quien se dedica a la venta de productos de todo tipo en su modesta despensa. Comenta que tiene un pequeño negocio bien surtido, donde ofrece buena atención a sus clientes, además de buen precio. 
Ella desea seguir dándole buena calidad y servicio a sus clientes, y por ello solicita el crédito, para poder abastecer su negocio con comestibles, bebidas, y demás insumos.
texts.en:
The “Acosta Ñu” group is from the city of Concepción and has 19 female members; they are all friends and neighbors from that city.  They are very tenacious women who want to get ahead.  They struggle daily to give their families what they need day to day.

One of the members is Trifina who sells all types of products in her modest store.  She comments that she has a well-stocked store where she offers good customer service and affordable prices.  She wants to continue providing good quality and service to her customers and this is why she’s asking for a loan to be able to stock her store with foodstuffs, beverages and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, beverages and other supplies.

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en: Kanha, 29, is single and resides with her niece in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics for over four years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. In order to improve her business, Kanha is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to raise capital for her business to purchase more clothes and shoes to resell. This purchase will help her have more fashionable clothes and shoes to sell and make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for living in.

loans.use: to raise capital for her business to purchase more clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 56 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. Nancy is married with 3 children. 

Nancy has a general store that sells a variety of products. Nancy has had this business for 2 years. Nancy requested a loan of 14,000 PHP  to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 

Nancy has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Nancy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Marisol July

texts.es:
La socia Marisol July alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,aceite entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia,la socia trabaja en su negocio todos los dias desde las 06:00am hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamente,la socia desea que su negocio cresca.

La socia solicito el prestamo para la compra de mas mercaderia para su negocio como en la compra de gaseosas y cerveza.

La socia Marisol July se siente feliz con el prestamo y se compromete a pagar en el tiempo estipulado.
texts.en:
Marisol July alternates her daily activities with working in her grocery store. She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, crackers, oil, and others. She is a responsible person with a strong desire to help her family get ahead. She works in her store from 6:00am until about 10:00pm every day and would like for her business to grow.

She is asking for the loan to purchase more merchandise for her store like soft drinks and beer. She is happy with her loan and is committed to pay the amount in the stipulated contract.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and beer for her store

loans.name: Viki

texts.es:
Viki vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva y esparrago. Es una mujer muy trabajadora pero cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho disfrutar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo arroz Chaufa; Viki solo estudió hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser secretaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo Viki sale a trabajar todos los días en su negocio de venta de bebidas, refrescos y sándwich y bocaditos en un local que ella alquila, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 45 clientes diariamente, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tienen una buena sazón para la preparación de los sándwich y sobre todo porque es amable y muy conocida por los clientes.

Viki está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mesas y sillas para su negocio y poder darle una mejor atención a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, así ella podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Viki lives in the city of Ica, a city known for having a warm climate at any time of the year and also for its agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, grapes, and asparagus.  She is a hard-working woman, but when she has free time she really likes to enjoy one of her favorite dishes which is the delicious "arroz Chaufa" (fried rice).  Viki only studied until the fifth grade of secondary school but she would have really liked to study to be a secretary.  

With a lot of enthusiasm, Viki goes to work every day in her business of selling drinks, refreshments, sandwiches, and snacks in a location that she rents.  She works around 10 hours a day and can take care of up to 45 customers daily.  She believes her business is doing well because she has a good seasoning for making the sandwiches and above all is friendly and well known by the customers.

Viki is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have offered her she will be able to buy tables and chairs for her business and will be able to give more attention to her customers and improve her income.  Thus, she will be able to keep fighting to make her biggest dream a reality – "To have her own house".

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 33 años de edad, conviviente y con 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus hijos,la cual está ubicada en el Caserío CP-10 Lote 81 Dist. Tambogrande. Vive en la parte rural  de este distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad a la que se dedica Miguel es a agricultura, para lo cual tiene 1 hectárea de terreno agrícola, que ha sido fruto de la herencia de sus padres. En dicho terreno tiene sembrado toda el área de mango en producción. Complementariamente trabaja en su mototaxi con la cual genera ingresos diarios y ayuda a mantener el equilibrio económico en su hogar.
El monto del préstamo es de 3000 nuevos soles, los cuales se invertirán en la compra de fertilizantes, úrea y agroquímicos para que el cultivo de mango progrese.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 33-year-old man with 2 children in his charge.  He lives in his own house with the children and his life partner, located in the Caserio [Settlement] CP-10, Lot 81, in the district of Tambogrande. This is in the rural portion of this district but it does have electrical service.

Miguel is dedicated to agriculture and has 1 hectare of agricultural land, the fruit of an inheritance from his parents.  On his entire plot he has mangoes in production. In addition, he drives a 'moto-taxi', from which he derives daily income that helps maintain the economic stability of his home.

The amount of Miguel's requested loan is 3,000 new sols, to be invested in purchasing fertilizers, urea, and agrochemicals to assure that his mango trees continue their growth.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agrochemicals for growing mangos.

loans.name: Débora

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes et des colliers, chaines et autres depuis 2002, Débora est une femme de 39ans et a en charge 04 enfants tous à l’école.  Le premier a 23ans et le dernier 05ans. Son conjoint est transporteur. Elle vend ses marchandises à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé et au Bénin. Elle souhaite ne pas perdre ses clients c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises pour mieux répondre à leurs demandes. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité , l’agrandir pour  avoir une grande boutique et contribuer par son apport financier au développement de la famille.
texts.en: A retailer of fabric, necklaces, chains and other jewelry since 2002, Débora is 39 years old and takes care of 4 children who are all in school. The oldest is 23 and the youngest is 5. Her husband works in transportation. She sells the products from her home and buys her inventory in Lomé and in Bénin. She doesn't want to lose her clientele, so she is requesting a second loan to purchase inventory to meet her clients' demand. She plans to reinvest in the business, grow the business to have her own store and contribute financially to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and fabric.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is from Liposong, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Cheryl is married and has 2 children. 

To make a living, Cheryl plants & harvests corn and coconut to sell. Cheryl has been in her business for 5 years and earns PHP 5,000 a month from these activities. In 2008, Cheryl joined GDMPC. 

Cheryl is requesting a loan of PHP 7,875, which will be used to purchase young seedlings to plant. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase young seedlings to plant

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
Sanu is 55 years-old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 31 and 26.  In 2000, she established her cow's milk selling business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  Sanu has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buys a young milk cow.  In the future, Sanu plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buys a cow

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Hon, 47, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over three years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her oldest daughter runs a business of buying cashew nut to resell. She earns about USD 3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Hon is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to raise capital for her business to purchase more groceries to sell. By doing so, she would be able to earn more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to use the additional profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family’s living condition.

loans.use: buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Tho, 53, is widowed and resides with four children in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been selling grilled beef, boiled eggs and drinks for over a year, earning approximately USD 6 per day. One of her children is employed in a restaurant and earns about USD 3 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Tho is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital for her business to purchase more drinks to sell. This purchase would enable her to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: buy drinks to sell

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Paz has a shop that sells different kinds of fresh and dried seafood. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy  a variety of fish and died fish to sell, like dalagang bukid, milk fish, tamban, flying fish, and dried seafood like dried squid, dried shrimp and sap-sap.

Paz has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Paz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy seafood to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.

Jocelyn has a shop that sells a variety of fish like milk fish, flying fish, dalagang bukid and tilapya. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of fish to sell like milk fish, sap-sap, dalagang bukid and squid.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell like dalagang bukid, tam ban, milk fish, flying fish and squid

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.

To earn a living, Lydia has a business making and selling snacks and juices like cassava cake, banana cake, fruit cake and juices like buko juice, pineapple juice and mango juice. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.

Lydia has a requested loan for 9,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks such as flour, sugar, powdered juice, cassava chips, cheese and banana chips.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI for 2 years.  In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks like cassava cake, fruit cake and hot cake

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, 57, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for over twenty years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle. She earns approximately 6 USD per day. Her husband helps her run the business. All of her children are employed. They earn about 9 USD per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Heang is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase cattle to resell for a profitable price. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell for a profitable price

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su novia e hijo de 2 años de edad, en una casa que no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe, en el caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco III, que se ubica a 6 Km del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

David y su novia son una pareja muy trabajadora. Ella se dedica a labores de crianza de ganado ovino y porcino y David se dedica a la agricultura, actualmente tiene plantaciones de mango y limón en un terreno que sus padres le heredaron. David cosecha el limón cada 15 días y esto le reporta buenos ingresos. Esta pareja de emprendedores se dedica a estas actividades desde hace dos años, debido al nacimiento de su niño.

David solicita un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. El destino del crédito será para la compra de fertilizantes y limpieza de terreno, para asegurar una buena producción tanto del mango como del limón. Incrementando sus inventarios y por ende las ventas, para seguir creciendo en su actividad.

Esta familia tiene muchos deseos de superación.
texts.en:
David is 31 years old and lives with his fiancée and 2-year-old son in a house that lacks the basic services of lights, water, and sewer, in the settlement of El Porvenir [The Future] Hualtaco III, located some 6 kilometers from Tambogrande district, in Piura.

David and his fiancée are a hard-working couple. She raises cattle and pigs and David is a farmer. At present, they have plantings of mango and lemon on land they inherited from their parents. David harvests the lemons each 15 days and this brings good earnings. This entrepreneurial couple have been dedicated to these activities for the last 2 years, due to the birth of their son. 

David is requesting a loan of 1,500 new sols through Edpyme Alternativa. The money will be used to buy fertilizers and to clear land, in order to promote good production of mangoes and lemons. This will increase David's inventories and, in the end, his sales, assuring that production continues to grow.

This family has much desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and clear his land.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is married and has 3 children. She is 41 years old and resides at Hoyohoy, Tangub City, Philippines. Angelica raises bananas for sale to earn a living and she's been 20 years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 3,187 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

In 2006, Angelica joined GDMPC. Angelica wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan, 54, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for more than twenty years, earning approximately 5 USD per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about 8 USD per day. 

Nan wants to run an additional business in order to improve her family’s economy. With this goal in mind, Nan is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service. This purchase would enable him to earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok, 26, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over ten years, earning approximately 6 USD per day. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Pok is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase cattle to breed in order to resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed in order to resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Hon, 40, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs public transportation service (motor taxi). He earns about USD 4 per day. Two of her children are employed in garment factory. Approximately, they earn USD 6 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Hon is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase will help her reduce the transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her present house to make it bigger to provide enough space for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Reynaida

texts.en:
Reynaida is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Reynaida has a shop that buys & sells fish,spices and food seasoning. She has had this business for 25 years. She requested a loan for 25,000 to buy ginger,beans,tomatoes,bell pepper,dried fish,home use products,biscuits,soap,junk food,bread,fabric softener,beverages and milk.
Reynaida has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.In the future, Reynaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fish like milk fish,sap-sap ,spices and food seasoning

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Erwin has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. He had this business for 8 years. He requested a loan for 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks,diaper,shampoo,soap,fabric softener & beverages.
Erwin has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Erwin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,cereals,snacks,beverages and soap

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel, 36, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leo, an overseas contract worker, and a mother of two children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Raquel operates a vegetable growing farm. She grows vegetables and some papayas in their farm located in Cavite, it is in the high lands where it is suited to grow vegetables and other fruits. She sells her product to market and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php3000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Raquel dreams to be able to give her all her family a good and future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farming materials and other supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Amelita has a shop that  buys and sells RTW's like T shirts, pants, short pants, dressses and men's wear. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stocks of RTW's to sell like underwear's, okay-okay and bags.
Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 .In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of RTW's to sell like Tshirts, short pants, pants, dresses and bags

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Jocelyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products,beverages and banana. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks,beverages and banana.
Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 .  In the future,Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additonal stocks of bananas, beverages, junk foods, bread and snacks

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Carmelita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks,cereals,shampoo & beverages.
Carmelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Carmelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods,soap,cereals,shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 43, is married, resides with her husband and five children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband runs the business of purchasing junk materials to resale at the junk shop. He earns about USD 7 per day. Three of her children are employed in garment factory. Approximately, they earn USD 12 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Touch is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to raise capital in her business to purchase more groceries to resale. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris  is a thirty two year old married lady, with two children.She runs a salon and has been in the business for two years now and gets a monthly income of KES. 20,000,which she uses to support her family basic needs. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to purchase a hair dryer. With the profits, she plans to save and pay school fees for her children. In future she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to use the entire loan to  purchase a hair dryer

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назире 22 года, замужем, воспитывает  3-х летнюю дочку. В качестве основного источника  дохода для своей семьи, Назира занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2009 году. Благодаря упорному труду Назиры,  ее хозяйство, начатое с суммы 50,000 сом  позволяет ей иметь  прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) с месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nazira is 22 years old, married and raising a three-year-old daughter.  To provide a source of income for her family, Nazira is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business in 2009.  Thanks to her hard work, her business, started with a sum of 50,000 som, now allows her to make a profit of 15,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  In order to further develop her business, Nazira requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a future increase of domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dental 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Dental 2" est un groupe de solidarité dont les cinq membres s'activent dans le commerce de  vêtements pour femmes et enfants.Elles se cotisent pour constituer une caution afin de prendre des prets auprès de UIMECEC et acheter des marchandises en gros . Elles se partagent en fonction de leurs apports et revendent leurs marchandises en détails.Le chef de  groupe , en médaillon, est mère de trois enfants. Elle a implanté une cantine devant son domicile et y expose ses produits. Elle arrive à se prendre en charge et à appuyer son mari dans les dépenses alimentaires. Le groupe sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des vêtements pour femmes et enfants. Le groupe a pour ambition de s'implanter au marché central de sa localité.
texts.en: The solidarity group "Dental 2" has five members who are in the business of selling clothing for women and children. They all contribute to have a loan guarantee with UIMECEC and purchase clothing wholesale. They divide up the work amongst themselves in order to resell the clothing. The leader of the group, on the far right, is a mother of three children. She set up a small cafe in front of her house and displays their products for sale.  She is able to be help her husband with their home's food expenses. The group is requesting a loan of 500,000 cfa francs to purchase clothing for women and children. The group hopes to establish a stall in the village's central marketplace.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for women and children.

loans.name: Zikrullo

texts.ru: Зикрулло-молодой мужчина,хороший семьянин и содержит свою семью зарабатывая ремонтом квартир и домов.Жена Дилафруз воспитывает детей и присматривает за хозяйством.Зикрулло раньше работал в бюджетной организации,но так как зарплаты не хватало на проживание,он оставил свою работу и обучился ремонтным работам и уже более года занимается этим делом.Он уже имеет своих клиентов и хорошо зарабатывает.С нами работает более года и несколько раз получил кредит на свои нужды.Так как у него молодая семья, он живет отдельно и обставляет свою квартиру на каждый кредит. Сейчас у него намечается мероприятие по поводу рождения второго сына и он хочет использовать  очередной кредит на это небольшое мероприятие.
texts.en: Zikrullo is a young man and a good family man, who supports his family by making repairs to apartments and houses.  His wife, Dilafruz, raises children and looks after the household.  Zikrullo previously worked at a financial organization, but because that salary was not sufficient for living, he left that work, learned repair work and has been involved in this business for over a year.  He already has clients and earns well.  Zikrullo has been working with us for over a year and obtained loans for his needs several times.  Because he has a young family, he lives separately and furnishes his apartment with each loan.  Currently, he has an event planned to celebrate the birth of his second son and wants to use this loan for this small event.

loans.use: to put together a party for his son's birth

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María es una mujer joven que inicia el desarrollo de su actividad porcina con un primer crédito que recibió de fundación mujer hace más de un año. 
Ella vive en una comunidad rural en Cartago , El Guarco,donde las fuentes de trabajo asalariadas son pocas.Por lo que el desarrollo de pequeñas actividades de subsistencia le permite tener ingresos y apoyar gastos de su familia.
Ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos quienes son menores de edad.
Para incrementar sus ingresos está capacitandose en un curso de masajes terepeúticos y quiere ampliar su pequeña porqueriza .Por lo que solicita nuevamente un préstamo a la fundación, el cual pagará según su ciclo productivo.
Ella como todas nuestras mujeres atiende su casa y también cuida de sus cerdos, limpia su porqueriza dos veces al día en las mañanas y al final de la tarde.
Para ella el poder contar con apoyo financiero es una oportunidad de crecer y salir adelante, mejorar sus condiciones económicas y dar un mejor futuro a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a young women that began the development of her pig business with her first loan that she received from the foundation for women over a year ago. She lives in a rural community in Cartago, El Guarco, where the sources of salaried work are few. Through the development of small subsistence activities, she is permitted to have earnings and to support the expenses of her family. She lives with her spouse and her two children who are very young. 

To increase her earnings, she is completing a therapeutic massage class and she wants to grow her small pig farm. Because of this she seeks a new loan from the foundation. She is like all of our women--she tends to her house and she also cares for her pigs, cleaning the pig farm two times a day, in the morning and in the evening. For her, the power to count on financial support is an opportunity to grow and progress, to improve her economic condition and to give a better future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase food and fattening pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman who has two children. Emma is 40 years old and resides at Canicapan, Clarin, Mis. Occ., Philippines. Emma owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living, and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 4,318 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

In 2011, Emma joined GDMPC. In the future, Emma wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn, 29, is widowed, resides with her parents and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. 

Due the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Morn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run a groceries store at home to generate extra income to support the family. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make more comfortable for her family’s and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 34 years old, married lady. She has been selling clothes for seven years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more clothing material for her business. 

In future she wants to expand her business and improve her family’s welfare.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material for her business

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has three children.

Taleb owns a workshop since 1989, for cars painting, repairing and selling cars wheels. He has more than twenty years experience, he worked in this field since childhood. He has a good reputation and he is being well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $1800 loan in order to purchase an electrical generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to purchase an electrical generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Rosalina has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages.Aside from that she also owned a tricycle use for transporting passengers in their community and her husband is  the driver. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks,beverages,firewood and tool for the maintenance of their tricycle.
Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Rosalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods,junk foods,soap, fire wood and tools for the maintenance of the tricycle

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny, 51, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been making round baskets to sell for more than two years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about USD 4 per day. One of her children is a garment worker. She earns about USD 2 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Vanny is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase farmland for growing more agricultural crops. This money will help her expand her agricultural business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run groceries store at home and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a big new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more farmland for growing more agricultural crops

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 48, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Regino, a driver, and mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Nenita operates a coconut stand. She buys coconut fruit that are native to the Philippines which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of coconut to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nenita dreams to be grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of coconuts needed in her business

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has two children.

Kassem is an owner for a bakery since 1999, selling bread and pastries. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply $2400 loan in order renovate his bakery and to build a new stone oven. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to renovate his bakery and to build a new stone oven.

loans.name: Metrine Nasimiyu

texts.en: Metrine is 35 years of age married to Alex and blessed with a nine months old baby. She runs a beauty salon, a business she started six years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She wants to purchase two dryers and two blow dry machines. Her profit will contribute towards her opening more branches of her business. Metrine dreams of being a great entrepreneur in the future and seeing her children get the best education. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase two dryers and two blow dry machines.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
This is Julita, 48, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Donato, her business partner, and a mother of three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Julita operates a vegetable growing farm. She grows vegetables and some bananas in their farm located in Cavite, it is in the high lands where it is suited to grow vegetables and other fruits. She sells her product to market and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php30, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Julita dreams to be able to give her all her family a good and future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farming materials and other supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina  is a thirty six  year old married lady. She is a farmer  and has been in the business for six years now and gets a monthly income of five thousand shillings.
 
This will be her first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizer. In future she wants to expand her business and be self reliant.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Barra

texts.fr: Barra est un homme marié et père de trois enfants.Il exerce le métier de tailleur depuis plus de dix ans.Il a démarré avec une seule machine qu'il avait pris à crédit. Mais aujourd'hui, il travaille avec quatre machines et emploie trois jeunes de son quartier.Son activité est assez rentable surtout à la veille des différentes fêtes de l'année.Il entretient ainsi sa famille avec les revenus tirés de son activité.Afin d'améliorer la qualité de ses services, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter une machine "cornière".Son ambition est d'ouvrir un autre atelier de couture.
texts.en: Barra is married and the father of four children. He has been a tailor for 10 years. He started his business with just one sewing machine which he bought on credit. But today he has four machines and employs three young people from his neighborhood. His business has been profitable especially on nights before special holidays. He is able to take care of his family with the profits from his business. To improve the quality of his services, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 cfa francs to purchase a specialty embroidery sewing machine. His goal is to open another workshop.

loans.use: to purchase a specialty embroidery sewing machine.

loans.name: Liene

texts.en:
Liene is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Liene has a business selling snacks like native delicacies such as "biko" hot cake, suman (a variety of rice cake made with coconut milk and wrapped with banana leaf), buko (young coconut) pie, and apple pie. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Liene has requested a loan to buy raw ingredients for making snacks like flour, sugar, margarine, and cheese.

Liene has been a member of HSPFI for three years. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks like banana cake, cassava chips, fruit cake, and buko pie.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Raised in Hawaii, Veronica, 41, wanted to bring the relaxed feel of the island to her hometown of San Antonio by opening the hair salon, Hair in Paradise. "I don’t like the everyday-type salons,” Veronica said. What sets her salon apart, she said, is her hospitality.

By the age of 17, Veronica decided to get into the cosmetology industry. Shortly afterwards, she studied cosmetology in Hawaii. She studied cosmetology again when she returned to San Antonio in 2002. She has 23 years of hair styling experience and opened her business in 2005.

“Becoming an entrepreneur is something that I always wanted to do,” she said. “I worked in places where it’s been a lot of chaos. When you get women together, you get a lot of opinions. I wanted to have my own place to give customer service my way. I listen to the customers and give them what they ask for.”

This initiated Veronica’s new loan with ACCION Texas Inc. She plans to use it to purchase items from Hawaii to resell within the shop, as requested by her clientele, and to improve its Hawaiian paradise feel. Veronica also plans to update her shop with new paint and repair minor problems.

Continuing about her love for the industry, Veronica said, “I like working with hair and am comfortable with making people feel good about themselves.” She said,  “If your hair looks good, you feel good. It’s gratifying to me to know I can do that.”

At Hair in Paradise, Veronica employs two other people: one receptionist and one stylist. As her business grows, Veronica plans to hire more employees. 

Veronica said the loan will help her business grow and allow her salon “to be more inviting to my customers and make them feel more relaxed.”

A returning ACCION client, Veronica said previous loans affected her business positively. “ACCION is a good company,” she said. “The loan officers I worked with seemed interested in what I wanted to do. I felt comfortable with them.” 

Those previous loans allowed her to make her salon more comfortable, have the necessities needed to build the shop and make it stronger. 

Find Veronica on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/pages/Hair-In-Paradise/140584502644859 or at her website, www.hairinparadise.com.

loans.use: to purchase gift items to sell in her salon

loans.name: José María

texts.es: El señor José María es trabajador y emprendedor. Él es agricultor actividad que viene realizando desde hace 40 años la cual aprendió de sus padres. El crédito lo invertir en insumos para preparar la tierra para la siembra de maíz y yuca entre lo principal que comprara es abono completo, urea, insecticidas, limpia y el periodo de arranque.
texts.en: Jose Maria is a hard working and entrepreneurial man. He has been working in agriculture for 40 years, a trade he learned from his parents. With this loan he will invest in inputs to prepare his land to primarily to plant corn and yuca. He will buy manure, urea, insecticides, and tools to extract roots to prepare the soil.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as compost, urea, and insecticides.

loans.name: Sok Na

texts.en:
Sok Na, 52, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about USD 2 per day. Sok Na is a very hardworking and hardship-bearing person. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Sok Na is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase silk threads to use in her weaving work. This money will help her produce more clothes to sell and generate more income to support the family.
 
In the future, she would like to expand her weaving business and help her child get a Bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase silk threads to use in her weaving work.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor José es una persona muy trabajadora,  el  nos  comenta  que  actualmente   desea  terminar  la construcción de  la  barda  de  su  casa,la cual no pudo  concluir debido a que no contaba con el capital suficiente, es por ello que esta  muy  contento  de habernos  encontrado  ya   que   ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  que  su  casa  tenga  una  mayor  seguridad y  así   cuando   salga  a su trabajo  lo hará  de una  manera  mas  tranquila   al saber  que  su   hogar  se  encuentra  protegido.
texts.en: José is a person who is very dedicated to his work.  He comments that he wants to finish building a wall at his house that he was unable to finish because he did not have enough capital to do so.  This is why he’s very happy to have found us because he sees in the loan the possibility that his house will be more secure so that when he goes out to work he will have more peace of mind knowing that his home is protected.

loans.use: to construct a wall to protect his house.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente del Cantón Sucre  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 19 y 14 años de edad, el mayor de sus hijos es discapacitado lo cual es una carga muy dura para nuestra amiga, el menor estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella  junto  a su esposo se dedican a la venta de larvas de camarón, para lo cual cuentan con un laboratorio donde cultivan y alimentan estas larvas para luego llevarlas a vender a camaroneras tanto dentro de la ciudad como  fuera de ella,  es un proceso un tanto delicado ya que ellos compran los huevecillos del camarón y en su laboratorio los van incubando y  alimentando para que tengan un buen desarrollo, una vez que ya estén listos los lleva a entregar a las distintas camaroneras de la ciudad y del país,  llevan más de 15 años en este negocio y les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar larvas de camarón y alimento para las mismas para que  tengan un buen desarrollo. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya tres años y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos. 

Su sueño es tener otro laboratorio para administrarlo ella sola.
texts.en:
The "1 de Diciembre" communal bank meets every two weeks in the seaside town of San Clemente in Sucre canton. This place is known for its lovely beaches, which are very popular with many tourists from around the country and abroad. It offers a variety of beautiful places and a rich selection of traditional regional dishes.

This is where we met Carmen. She is 42, married, and has two children, ages 19 and 14. The eldest of her children is disabled, which is a very difficult burden for our friend. The youngest goes to school. Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband sell shrimp larvae, for which purpose they have a laboratory where they grow and feed these larvae. Then they take them to sell to shrimp farms both inside and outside the city. 

It is a rather delicate process, as they buy the little shrimp eggs, and gradually incubate and feed them in their laboratory so that they develop properly. Once they are ready, she delivers them to the various shrimp farms in the city and elsewhere in the country. She has been in this business for more than 15 years and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy shrimp larvae, and feed for them so that they develop properly.  She has been in the communal bank for three years now, and likes it because the interest rates are very low. 

Her dream is to have another laboratory to run by herself.

loans.use: To buy shrimp larvae and feed.

loans.name: María Celia

texts.es: María Celia tiene 32 años de edad y habita junto a su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su compañero de vida, dos hijos y su madre. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para todos los gustos y preferencias. El negocio está ubicado en su hogar de habitación el cual atiende día con día y ocasionalmente vende ambulante en sitios de alta concurrencia de personas, para poder ganarse el pan diario. Se caracteriza por ser  una mujer muy emprendedora y responsable. Tiene mucha clientela ya que se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes que cada día la prefieren mas, ya que siempre reciben un buen trato de parte de María; y los precios de los artículos son muy accesibles. Este negocio le ayuda mucho  con la economía del hogar puesto que los ingresos que su esposo genera no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que ha decidido acercarse a INTEGRAL, para que le extienda apoyo otorgándole este credito, ya que ha decidido invertir en su negocio en la compra de nueva mercadería (faldas, blusas, ropa interior, vestidos, etc.) para surtir su negocio y poder así atraer a más clientes. Confía que con esta inversión sus ganancias aumentaran y podrá colaborar un poco más en la economía de su hogar con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones económicas y las de su familia las cuales por el momento son muy humildes y su deseo es poder cambiar esa situación.
texts.en:
María Celia is 32 years old and lives within a family unit which comprises her life partner, their two children, and her mother.
She sells clothing to suit all tastes and preferences. The business is located inside her home, and she tends to it daily. Occasionally she sells on the street, at places where there are large concentrations of people, so that she can earn her daily bread. 
She is a very driven and responsible woman. She has a large customer base because she has earned her customers' trust. They prefer her more and more every day, because they always receive good service from María and the prices of her articles are very affordable. 
This business helps her greatly with her home finances, because the income generated by her husband is not enough to cover household expenses. That is the reason why she has decided to approach Integral, in order to receive support by being granted this loan. 
She has decided to invest in her business and purchase new merchandise (skirts, blouses, underwear, dresses, etc.) to stock her business in order to attract more customers. She trusts that this investment will increase her profits and allow her to contribute a little further to the home finances. 
Her goal is to improve her and her family's financial position, which is very humble. Her desire is to change that situation.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, blouses, underwear, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Katty

texts.es:
Katty es una joven muy entusiasta, junto a su esposo tienen 3 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 12, 6 y 4 meses de edad, a los cuales adora mucho y son su mejor razón para seguir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se puedan presentar; su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Santiago, Ica Perú, el distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, esparrago, en este distrito se ubican varias empresas agroexportadoras, las cuales han brindado muchos puestos de trabajo. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo con Causa rellena y cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta ver televisión en especial sus novelas. Ella solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ciencias de la comunicación.

Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Katty logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja alrededor de 3 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 10 clientes al día, también los fines de semana trabaja en su negocio de animación infantil y alquiler de proyectores, ella se animo a tener este negocio porque necesitaba tener más ingresos para poder atender de mejor manera al mas pequeño de sus hijos; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy conocida por los clientes y los atiende de manera amable.

Katty está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio de venta de ropa en especial ropa de dama por el día de la madre; así ella podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, con los cual le permitirá seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Grabar su CD de música infantil”.
texts.en:
Katty is a very enthusiastic young woman. She and her husband have three children, ages 12, 6 and 4 months, whom they adore greatly and who are their best reason for moving ahead despite the difficulties they may encounter. They live in the Santiago district of Ica, Peru. The Santiago district is known for its agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, corn, and asparagus. Various agricultural export businesses are located in the district, which provide many job opportunities. Like any good Peruvian, Katty enjoys the traditional food of the country. One of her favorite dishes is the delicious “Arroz con pollo con causa rellena.” When she has a little spare time she likes to watch television, especially her telenovelas. She only studied until the fifth grade but would have like to have studied the science of communications.

Through hard work and saving, Katty was able to start her business selling clothing. She works about 3 hours a day and can tend up to 10 clients a day. She also works weekends in children’s entertainment and the rental of projectors. She was inspired to have this business because she needed to earn more income in order to better care for the smallest of her children. She feels her business is going well because she is very well known by her customers  and she provides friendly and courteous service.   

Katty is very grateful to KIVA lenders since, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her clothes selling business, especially women’s clothing for Mother’s Day. Thus she will be able to offer a greater variety of products and improve her income. This will enable her to continue fighting, day after day, to make her dream a reality. Her dream is to record a children’s music CD.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (women's clothing).

loans.name: Tusaidiye Plus Group

texts.en:
Kengi, aged 58, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank “Tusaidiye Plus”. The group is composed of nineteen members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI, HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Kengi started her business in 1972. She sells smoked fish at the market located west of the city of Kinshasa. She has spent most of her life in different micro-businesses and she has acquired solid experience. After being involved in different micro-enterprises, today Kengi focuses her efforts and ability on selling smoked fish. 

As the fish demand is high in her community, she intends to use the next loan to increase her stock of fish and resell them with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $70. 

Her ambition is to open a storage facility. Kengi is a widow and has eight children, who are aged between 23 and 40 years old.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish and resell it at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 53 years old,  married to Joseph and blessed with six children aged 26,24,20,17, 15 and 12 years respectively. She practices farming, a business she ventured in 15 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She has requested for a loan worth KES. 100,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season, the anticipated profit will be ploughed back to his farming activity. 

Her dream is that she may continue with farming as well as educate her children. This is her fourth loan.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season

loans.name: Johna

texts.en: Johna is married who has 2 children. She is 37 years old and lives in Tipolo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Johna owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns 4,000 each month. She requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Johna became a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. Johna hopes to expand of her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Janette has a video-k shop in their community. Aside from that she also operates beauty salon that provides manicure,pedicure and hair cut . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 6,000 to buy tools for the maintenance of the video-k shop,for the beauty salon & pay for the electricity for the services.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for the maintenance of the video-K shop

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is thirty six years old, married lady with two children. She has a boutique business  and has been in the business for five years now and gets a monthly income of KES. 20,000. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy more clothes for sale. In future she wants to be able to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Roberto Elías

texts.es: Roberto Elías de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus preciosos hijos en zona urbana, es muy jovial y cariñoso con sus hijos, está orgulloso de su vida. Él se dedica a la venta de ropa, con gran variedad para damas, caballeros y niños, tiene faldas, pantalones, camisas, blusas entre otros, es  muy conocido en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha más clientela últimamente, pues todo lo que comercia es de excelente calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles, además el servicio es muy bueno. Roberto siempre trata de satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes; es un hombre totalmente dedicado a su trabajo siempre aprovechando oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que el que persevera alcanza sus más grandes anhelos, él quiere ver crecer su negocio y ya tiene experiencia crediticia es por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL nuevamente un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor y según tendencias de nueva moda. Roberto Elías tiene certeza que de esta forma podrá brindarle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Roberto Elías, 45, lives with his life partner and their two precious children in an urban area. He is very cheerful and affectionate towards his children, and is proud of his life. 

He makes a living selling a great variety of clothes for women, men, and children. He sells skirts, pants, shirts, and blouses among other items. He is very well known in the area and has gained many customers recently, since everything he sells is of excellent quality and sold at reasonable prices. Also, his service is very good. Roberto always tries to satisfy the needs of his customers. He is a man completely dedicated to his work and always takes advantage of opportunities that present themselves to him.
