Afin d'augmenter ses revenus, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter une seconde motocyclette Djakarta.Son ambition est de constituer un parc de motocyclette.
texts.en: Alassane is a young married man who provides motorcycle transport.  With this activity, he is able to take care of his own needs and to provide for his family.  In order to increase his income, he is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy a second "Jakarta" type motorcycle.  His ambition is to have a motorcycle fleet.

loans.use: to buy a "Jakarta" type motorcycle.

loans.name: Aracely Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Juan Eudes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Aracely, tiene 47 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos que en la actualidad ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos está soltero y aun viven con ella.

Ella con la finalidad de ganarse la vida y con esto poder   salir adelante tiene un local donde vende repuestos eléctricos. También tiene un negocio de venta de mariscos, las mismas que vende por libras,  ella aprovecha que su local es bastante amplio y allí mismo puede vender sus repuestos y los mariscos, trabaja de lunes a sábado  desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00. Los repuestos eléctricos  compra en Guayaquil y los mariscos se los envían desde Pedernales o va a comprar a Manta cuando necesita, su hijo le ayuda con su trabajo cuando tienen tiempo. Lleva más de 14 años con su negocio y es así como saco adelante a su familia después de la muerte de su esposo.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar repuestos eléctricos y mariscos. Es socia del Banco Comunal desde hace más de 11 años y le gusta por los beneficios y la ayuda que les brinda el banco.
 
Sus sueños son tener una ferretería y un frigorífico.
texts.en:
The San Juan Eudes communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton.  It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are known on a national and international level.  It is the place of the famous Panama straw hats.

This is where Aracely, age 47, lives.  Her husband died some years ago, and she was widowed.  However, they had four children.  They are all adults now, and one of them is single and still lives with her.

In order to earn a living and be able to get ahead she has a place where she sells spare electrical  parts.  She also has a business selling seafood, which she sells by the pound.  She takes advantage of the fact that her place is pretty large, and she can sell the sparet parts and the seafood there.  She works from Mondays through Saturdays from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.

She buys the spare electrical parts in Guayaquil.  The seafood is sent from Pedernales, or she goes to Manta to purchase the seafood when necessary.  Her son helps her with her work when he has time.  She has had her business for over 14 years.  This is how she got her family ahead after her husband’s death.

She will use the loan to buy spare electrical parts and seafood.  She has been a member of the communal bank for over 11 years.  She likes it for the benefits and the help that the bank offers.

Her dreams are to have a hardware store and a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy spare electrical parts and seafood.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is a thirty-year-old hard-working married woman with three children, living in Fort Portal Uganda. Her goal is to educate her children and build a permanent home. She has been a teacher for four years and has a vision of setting up income-generating activities to supplement her salary and buy land for constructing a residential house. Winnie needs the loan to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
Analee is 26 years old and single. She lives in the Philippines. 

Analee has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy additional stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Analee has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Analee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, cereals, junk foods, and beverages

loans.name: Jessica Soledad

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Juan Eudes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos  a la señora Jessica, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen una niña  de 12 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Ella es una muy buena de casa que  para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, vende bisutería en todas las variedades y modelos, ella sale a recorrer por las tardes de una o dos horas por día, deja a crédito y a sus clientes y les cobra cada semana, su mercadería la trae desde Guayaquil ciudad a la que viaja cada vez que necesita mercadería, lleva más de 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes que le compran sus productos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pulseras, collares, cadenas y otros artículos de bisutería. Lleva más de 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un bazar o una tienda.
texts.en:
San Juan Eudes Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Montecristi Cantón, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are appreciated both nationally and internationally. This is also where you find the famous Panama hat.

Here we get to know Sra. Jessica, 30, who is married and has a 12 year old daughter who is a student. Her husband is a tradesman.

Jessica is a very good housewife who, in order to help her husband with household expenses, is also a saleswoman. She sells all kinds and models of costume jewelry. She goes out for one or two hours a day every afternoon and sells on credit, collecting payments from her customers every week. She brings her merchandise from Guayaquil, a city she visits whenever she needs merchandise. She has been engaged in this endeavor for more than 5 years and it is going well since she has a large customer base.

She will use this loan to buy bracelets, necklaces, chains and other kinds of costume jewelry. She has been a member of the communal bank for more than two years and she likes it because of the help and benefits it provides.

Her dream is to own a market or a store.

loans.use: to purchase bracelets, necklaces, chains, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, 53, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Candido, a repair technician and father to her five young-adult children, four of whom are already working while the youngest is in college. By the grace of God, she has managed to support all her children’s educational needs. As of the present time, she is working hard to be able to maintain her finances for her youngest child’s college education.

Corazon operates an appliance-repair shop. Her husband is the main technician while she handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. They offer repair and check-up of all types of appliances, like electric fans, washing machines, air-conditioning, and others. Her shop is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts for the appliances they repair. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Corazon hopes her business will grow and dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare appliance-parts needed for her repair business.

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday is a thirty-year-old hard-working man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for four years. He started his business with one million UGX and now has only three million. His hardships include price fluctuations and inflation, high fuel and transportation costs, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goals are to buy a car, to educate himself, and to save for a wedding. His business goals are to buy land to grow crops, to expand his business into new markets, and to move his business to a more permanent location. Monday has requested a loan to buy mattresses to sell.

loans.use: to buy mattresses for sale.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 57-year-old married father of one child. Having graduated from university with a “good” mention, he has been in the accounting and auditing field for 30 years and has been running his own office for 18 years. Nabil’s reliability is derived from his long-lasting experience, his strong work ethics and the trust of his various customers.

Committed to expanding his work scope and developing its environment, Nabil needs additional financing assistance. Therefore, he is applying for a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua, to refurbish his office’s furniture and to use the rest to refurbish his living room. On the professional level, this will enhance his customer service and, on the personal level, will provide him with a comfortable environment at home after long stressful working hours.

This is Nabil's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good-standing repayment history.

loans.use: to refurbish his office’s furniture

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, es madre de 6 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero su hija de 23 años vive con ella y siempre la acompaña y la apoya en todo;  Ysabel ha pasado por momentos difíciles a lo largo de su vida, a los 16 años se caso y quedo viuda , pero luego de un tiempo se caso de nuevo pero su pareja la abandono y crio a sus hijos sola y se esforzó mucho por sacarlos adelante; a su lado vive su madre de 94 años de edad a la cual cuida y ama mucho ya que tiene 94 años de edad y a pesar de su edad la mama de Ysabel trabaja en el campo, es un ejemplo de que la edad no es impedimento para trabajar y sentirse útil; La vivienda de Ysabel se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por playas hermosas, clima cálido, su agricultura y sobre todo la amabilidad de sus pobladores.

Desde pequeña Ysabel aprendió lo que ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente, ya que apoyaba a su madre; por ello Ysabel tomo la decisión de tener su negocio de venta de flores en el cual trabaja actualmente, se animo ya que su madre le enseño como se hacen los arreglos y ya lleva 15 años trabajando en ello, es muy amable con los clientes y por ello siempre la buscan y compran sus productos, por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio.

Ysabel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más flores para su negocio, en especial porque ya se acerca el día de la madre y siempre tiene pedidos , así ella mejorara sus ingresos y podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Tener un gran negocio de florería y comprarse un carro”.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a humble and hard-working woman.  She is the mother of 6 children, all of whom are grown.  But her 23-year old daughter lives with her, is always by her side and helps her with everything.  Ysabel has had difficult time throughout her life.  She was married at 16 and was widowed.  After a time, she married again, but her new partner left her.  She raised her children by herself and put forth a lot of effort to get them ahead.  Ysabel's 94-year old mother also lives with her.  Ysabel loves her very much and takes care of her.  In spite of her age, Ysabel's mother works in the fields.  She is an example that age is not an impediment to working and feeling useful.  Ysabel's home is in Imperial, a city known for its beautiful beaches, its warm climate, its agriculture and above all, the friendliness of its people.

Ysabel learned as a young girl helping her mother to "earn her bread by the sweat of her brow."  Because of that, Ysabel made the decision to have a business selling flowers, which is her current work.  She was excited about it, since her mother taught her to arrange the flowers.  She has now been in the business 15 years.  Ysabel is very friendly with her customers, and that is why they seek her out and purchase her products.  Ysabel believes that that is why her business is going well for her.

Ysabel is quite grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have offered, she will be able to purchase more flowers for her business.  This is especially important because Mother's Day is approaching, and she always has orders to fill.  Now Ysabel will improve her income and be able to keep working toward making her greatest dream a reality, "to have a big flower shop and to buy herself a car."

loans.use: to purchase flowers.

loans.name: Kyakimwa

texts.en: Kyakimwa is a fifty-year-old married woman with nine children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the bar business for four years. Her business hardships include price fluctuations and inflation, customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchase enough stock to meet the high demand, and high taxes. Her goals for her business are to hire employees to help grow the business and to expand the business into new markets. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent home. Kyakimwa has requested a loan in order to buy beer, sodas, and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, and spirits for sale.

loans.name: Tweyombeke Buraru Group

texts.en:
Salayi is a hard-working mother of three children living in Hioma, Uganda. She is the group leader of Tweyombeke Buraru and she owns a bar business. She has been running this business for 20 years and is still expanding it. She started it from savings she had made from farming activities.

Salayi faces challenges of inadequate capital to purchase enough stock and poor payment habits on the part of her customers. Salayi needs the loan to buy beer and sodas to sell in her bar.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers for sale.

loans.name: Doria

texts.en: Doria is a married woman with three children. She is 43 years old and resides at Tipolo, Plaridel Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Doria owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years. Each month, Doria earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In 2010, Doria joined GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, 25 years old, keeps pigs and owns a motorbike transport business. He has been in the business for three years and earns a monthly income of 32,000 shillings.

This will be Paul's first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy another motorbike. In the future, Paul wants to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all in school. She does not take care of additional family members. For the last 5 years, Olivia has operated a retail business selling charcoal from home. She works seven days a week. Olivia has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Her goals and hopes are to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land to build rental rooms. Olivia lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family .

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 29 year old single woman. She has had a dressmaking business for three years and earns a monthly income of 25,000 shillings. 

This will be her second  loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to open another dressmaking business in Limuru. 

In the future, she wants to become a more successful business woman.

loans.use: to open another dressmaking business in Limuru.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora de 37 años de edad, es madre de un pequño al cual saca adelante con mucho esfuerzo y amor, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro de paracas, lugares turísticos que reciben infinidad de personas para apreciar su belleza y esplendor, tanbien se le conoce por la amabilidad de su gente y por sus actividades principales como la pesca y la agricultura. Carmen rosa es muy trabajadora, inicio su negocio de venta de abarrotes desde hace ya 1 año y es que el principio no le fue muy fácil ya que no sabia mucho como llevar el negocio pero poco a poco aprendió y ahora su negocio va mejorando cada día, sobre todo por su fuerza y su empeño.

Carmen está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la yuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, fideos, menestras, entre otros, lo cual le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, asi ella seguirá trabajando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:2 tener un negocio mucho mas grande y darle la mejor educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a very  hard-working, 37 year old woman.  She is the mother of a little boy, who she gets ahead with a lot of effort and love.  Her home is in Pisco, a city known for having the Islas Ballestas (a group of small islands) and the  Candelabro de Paracas (a giant geoglyph), tourist sites that recieve vast numbers of people who admire their beauty and splendor.  Pisco is also known for its friendly people and main enterprises, fishing and agriculture.  Carmen Rosa is very hard-working.  She started her business selling groceries 1 year ago.  In the begninning, it wasn't very easy for her, as she didn't know much about running a business.  But little by little she learned.  Now her business is improving each day, largely because of her strength and determination.

Carmen is very grateful for the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have offered her, she will be able to purchase more merchandise for her business, like rice, sugar, noodles, mixed vegetables and other items.  This will allow her to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers and to improve her income.  Carmen will keep working day after day to make her greatest dream a reality: to have a much bigger business and to give her son the best education.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, mixed vegetables and other items).

loans.name: Jamini

texts.en:
Jamini is 51 years old, married to Nakundi, and blessed with four children, aged 17, 15, 13, and 10 years, respectively.  He has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 14,700. 

Jamini has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale. The profit he earns would be reinvested in his business in order to expand it. 

Jamini hopes to see himself become a great entrepreneur and own large-scale businesses. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Lucia has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store, which buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 22 years. She has requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy more stock of items such as canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Lucia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda, 23 years old, is married and has two children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda, and has been teaching for three years. Her personal goals are to educate children and to build a permanent home to live in. Brenda wants money to buy construction materials for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to open another place to sell food

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Twitezimbere / Gkn Group

texts.fr:
Félicien fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere/Gkn. Il a 42 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 2 ans à 18 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Félicien est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées et des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Félicien voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Félicien is part of the Twitezimbere/Gkn Group.  He is 42 years old, married, with six children between the ages of two and 18, of whom three are in school.  In addition to his children he cares for one other child.  He has six years of primary-level education.

Félicien cultivates rice.  This is his second loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use this loan to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

His business growth strategy is to use the best seed and fertilizers to cultivate his rice.  In the next year, Félicien would like to be the top producer in the region.  With his profits, he intends to pay for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Dukundubuhinzi №3 A/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Philippe fait partie du groupe Dukundubuhinzi no3 / Rsz. Il a 39 ans, il est marie avec 2 enfants de 3 ans à 6 ans, dont 1 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Philippe est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de sollicite d’autres crédit pour développer son agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Philippe voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Philippe is part of the Dukundubuhinzi no3 / Rsz Group.  He is 39 years old, married, with two children, aged 3 and 6, of whom one is in school.  He attended school through the third year of secondary school. 

Philippe cultivates rice.  This is his third loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

His business growth strategy is to use additional loans to grow his rice cultivation enterprise.  In the coming years, he hopes to be the top grower in the region.  With his profits, Philippe intends to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Abihuje / Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Madame Costasie est membre du groupe ABIHUJE / RBV et cultive les pommes de terre. Elle a 52 ans, mariée et a 7 enfants dont le plus âgé a 34 ans et le moins âgé a 8 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont à l'école et aucune autre personne est en sa charge.
Elle a commencé de travailler avec ACB en 2012. Le cycle actuel est le premier avec ACB. Le crédit lui octroyé lui a permit de payer la main d'oeuvre des gens qui ont cultivé son champs et d'acheter la semance (20 kgs des pommes de terre). Elle a une stratégie d'acheter un champs additionnel, ce qui la permettra de devenir la première dans ce domaine. Avec le profit, elle va construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Costasie is a member of the ABIHUJE / RBV Group and grows potatoes.  She is 52 years old, married, with seven children, the eldest of whom is 34 and the youngest is 8.  Three of her children go to school and she has not taken in any children in addition to her own.

She began to work with ACB in 2012; this is her first loan cycle with ACB.  This loan will allow her to pay wages to the workers who cultivate her fields and to purchase seed (20kg potatoes).  She has a plan to purchase an additional plot, which will allow her to be the top grower in her region.  With the profits, she will build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Vugukora A / Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Anastasie fait partie du groupe Vugukora A/Rbv. Elle a 54 ans, elle est marie avec 6 enfants de 12 ans à 24 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Elle a 2 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Anastasie est agricultrice de maïs. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 40 kgs de maïs pour les semences et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’acheter d’autres champs et augmenter les capacités des semences à utiliser. Dans les prochaines années, Anastasie voudrait être la première agricultrice dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Anastasie is part of the group Vugukora A/Rbv. She is 54 years old and married, and she has six children, from 12 to 24 years old. Two of the children are in school. She has two persons to support other than her children. She has a 6th grade education.

Anastasie is a corn farmer. This loan cycle is her first one with the microfinance institution ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy 40 kg of seed corn and to cover the cost of labor. 

Her strategy for the growth of her business is to buy more fields and to improve the seeds she uses.  In the next few years, Anastasie would like to be the No. 1 farmer in her region. With the profits, she plans on educating her children.

loans.use: to buy 40 kg of seed corn and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Kakoni Traders Group

texts.en: Wilson is a forty-one-year-old married man with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in salt business for ten years. His business hardships include price fluctuations and inflation, seasonal weather, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His goals for his business are to expand into new markets and to venture into timber sales. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home. Wilson has requested a loan to buy salt and timber to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt and timber for sale.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 48-year-old married father of one child. He previously worked in a sanitary wares store, but then decided to start his own business. For over a year, he has been running his own mini-market (grocery store), selling foodstuffs, vegetables, candies, juices and other items.

Hasan’s store is distinctive for its constant availability of goods and thus has very satisfied customers. In an effort to maintain his quality service and cater to his customers’ increasing needs, Hasan is applying for a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua. He will use the money to increase his product supply and to expand its range to provide cigarette packs. Growing the business will allow Hasan to finally have a sustainable source of income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to increase his product supply

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris, 36 years old, is married and blessed with two children, 17 and 4 years old.  She owns a a grocery store where she sells a variety of fruits and vegetables. She has operated this business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 21,950. 

Damaris has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. The profit she earns would be reinvested in her business in order to expand it. Damaris' dream is to become the leading vegetable distributor in Lodwar and to see her children get a good education. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en: Rose Marie is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child.  For the past 2 years, Rose Marie has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, junk foods and beverages. Rose Marie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, snacks and breads to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
This is Marlyn, 56, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and the mother of three children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. Marlyn works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marlyn operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Nenita earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Marlyn earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Marlyn is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marlyn hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Akuélé

texts.fr: Akuélé est une femme de 58ans. Elle est veuve et a 01 enfant de 32ans. Elle est revendeuse d'Atsiéké( une nourriture faite à base de manioc qui se mange avec du poisson) depuis 2004. Elle le fait à la maison et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle sollicite ce troisième crédit de WAGES pour acheter de l’Atsiéké et de la viande de bœuf. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité afin de mieux de réaliser de gros chiffre d’affaire et avoir une bonne situation financière.
texts.en:
Akuélé is a 58-year-old woman and a widow with a 32-years-old child. She has been a retailer of "atsiéké" (a food made from cassava that is eaten with fish) since 2004. She makes atsiéké  at home and gets her supplies in Lomé. 

Akuélé is requesting this third loan from WAGES to buy atsiéké and some beef. She wants to reinvest in her business in order to have better sales and a good financial situation.

loans.use: to buy cassava couscous

loans.name: Teresita De Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra Teresita de Jesus esta acudiendo con nosotros a solicitar un prestamo ya que ella necesita solventar los gastos de la educacion de uno de sus hijos el esta tomando un curso para desarrollar un oficio y asi poder superarse y le estan pidiendo material didactico para ello.
La sra. Teresita es madre soltera y ella solventa los gastos de sus hijo ahorita npo cuenta con toda la cantidad para poder comprar dicho material.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresita de Jesus has come to us to request a loan, as she needs to pay for one of her son's educational expenses.  He is taking a course to master a trade, and to thereby improve his situation.  They are asking for educational material for the course.
Sra. Teresita is a single mother and pays for her children's expenses.  Right now she doesn't have all the money to be able to purchase said materials.

loans.use: to purchase educational materials.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 37-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home. Paul has been a retailer for the last three years after mobilizing money from farming. His major hardships are price fluctuations and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops and of expanding his business into new markets. Paul needs a loan to buy used shoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all in school. She does not take care of additional family members. For the last 20 years, Mariam has operated a retail business selling secondhand clothes and bags at the market. She works six days a week.

Mariam has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes and bags. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Mariam's goals and hopes are to buy a truck to transport her products to her customers easily and to start selling wholesale only. Mariam lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing and bags

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome has been selling milk and snacks in Nakuru for the last two years. She is 41 years old and the mother of two children. Salome was introduced to KADET by one of its clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use this amount to buy more stock of milk and to buy snacks such as cakes and donuts for sale, thereby expanding her business.

In the future, Salome hopes to grow her business, open a big milk bar and supply milk to various customers. This would increase her income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more milk and snacks for sale.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr:
Ayaba est une femme âgée de 23 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 1 enfant qui ne va pas encore à l’école.
Ayaba travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle vend des friperies pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Ayaba a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des friperies. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et vendre des chaussures en gros.
Dans les prochaines années, Ayaba voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité et vendre des chaussures en gros. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ayaba is a 23-year-old woman who is married to a retailer. She has one child who is not yet in school. Ayaba has been working as a retailer since 2009. She sells used clothing to all comers at the market. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her main difficulty is an inventory shortage. 

Ayaba has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy some used clothing. She wants to reinvest in her business and to sell shoes in bulk. 

In the next few years, Ayaba would like to expand her business and sell shoes in bulk. With the profits, she says she plans to ensure her children are educated.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 26-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children, to build a permanent home and to help his parents.

James has been selling motorcycle spare parts for the last eight years. His major hardships are price fluctuations, customers not paying on time and theft. James' business goals are to expand his business to new markets, to hire employees to help expand his business and to move his business to a more permanent location. James needs a loan to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, both in school. She does not take care of additional family members. For the past year, Rebecca has operated a retail business selling milk from home. She works seven days a week.

Rebecca has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of milk. Rebecca generates additional income by selling samosas and donuts. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Rebecca's goals and hopes are to own a milk dairy plant and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a fifty-three-year-old single woman with one child. She is a farmer in Magina and has been in the business for fourteen years years now and gets a monthly income of eighteen thousand seven hundred and fifty shillings. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a cow to start dairy farming. 

In future she wants to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start dairy farming

loans.name: Nudjiratou

texts.fr:
Nudjiratou est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 3 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 8 ans.
Nudjiratou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1987. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Nudjiratou a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Nudjiratou voudrait augmenter la taille de son étalage. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nudjiratou is a 36-year-old woman who is married to a driver. She has three children who go to school. The oldest child is 12 years old, and the youngest is 8. Nudjiratou has been working as a retailer since 1987. She sells grocery items to all comers to her store. She purchases her goods in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her main difficulty is not being able to satisfy the demand. 

Nudjiratou has requested her third loan from WAGES to buy some grocery items. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the next few years, Nudjiratou would like to expand the size of her displays. With the profits, she says she plans to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Jackelyn Del Rosario

texts.es:
Jackelyn es una joven de 20 años la cual es muy trabajadora y entusiasta, vive junto a  su pareja a su pequeño hijo de 5 meses de edad, el cual es su adoración y al cual ama muchísimo por ello ella trabaja mucho para darle una vida feliz; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo es visitada por infinidad de turistas ya que allí se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina, asimismo en una ciudad donde se realiza la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago y uva. Cuando Rosario tiene un tiempo libre le gusta leer sobre todo algunos cuentos y los lee junto a su bebe, también le agrada disfrutar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual el riquísimo “arroz con pollo”; Rosario tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar Administración de empresas.

Día a día Jackelyn se esfuerza mucho por trabajar muy bien en su negocio de venta de salchipapas, pollo broster y también tiene una pequeña bodega donde vende abarrotes, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias y  puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene una buena sazón para la preparación de sus salchipapas y broster y es muy conocida en su barrio.

Jackelyn está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, menestras, bebidas gaseosas, entre otros, así  como también colocar piso en su vivienda, así ella podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y día a día seguirá trabajando para hacer cumplir su gran sueño.” Terminar de construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Jackelyn is 20 years old, and is a very hardworking, enthusiastic young woman. She lives with her partner and her 5-month-old son, whom she loves very much. She works hard to provide a good future for her son. Her home is located in Ica, a city that is known for its hot climate and as a major tourist attraction, since it is home to the famous Huacachina lagoon. Ica is an agricultural city, with an emphasis on the cultivation of cotton, asparagus and grapes. 

When Jackelyn has free time, she enjoys reading stories and reading to her baby. She also enjoys eating her favorite dish, “arroz con pollo” (chicken with rice). While Jackelyn did receive some secondary education, she would have liked to pursue a degree in business administration.

Jackelyn works hard every day to develop her business. She works cooking and selling fried chicken and salchipapas, a potato and sausage dish. She also has a small grocery store where she works 8 hours per day, and attends to about 15 customers on a daily basis. She believes business is going well because she prepares savory, delicious dishes, and she is well known in her neighborhood.

Jackelyn is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, which will help her purchase merchandise for her business, such as: rice, sugar, beans, soft drinks, etc. The support from this loan will also allow her to put in a floor in her home, which will help her improve the quality of services she offers her customers and improve her family’s quality of life. She hopes to continue working each day towards her goal of finishing construction of her home.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (rice, sugar, beans, soft drinks, and other items).

loans.name: Luz Rocio

texts.es:
Luz tiene 33 años, es madre y su hijo tiene 15 años de edad, Luz lo ama muchísimo aunque por la edad que tiene a veces le saca canas verdes pero a pesar de ello su hijo es su fuente de fortaleza para seguir adelante; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo es visitada por infinidad de turistas ya que allí se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina, asimismo en una ciudad donde se realiza la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago y uva.

Con mucho entusiasmo Luz trabaja en su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas, ella se dedica a su negocio 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes en el dia, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque se ubica en una zona donde pasa mucho público y porque atiende de manera amable a los clientes.

Luz está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una puerta para su vivienda ya que tendrá su negocio en su casa y ya no en la calle, asimismo comprara cervezas para poder ofrecer más productos a los clientes, con ello mejoraran sus ingresos y así seguirá luchando día a día para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño.” Tener una tienda muy grande”.
texts.en:
Luz is 33 years old, and is the mother of a 15-year-old son whom she loves very much. Even though he is in his teenage years and can be a handful, her son is her source of inspiration for fighting life’s daily struggles. Her home is located in Ica, a city that is known for its hot climate and as a major tourist attraction, since it is home to the famous Huacachina lagoon. Ica is an agricultural city, with an emphasis on the cultivation of cotton, asparagus and grapes. 

Luz works enthusiastically in her own business selling beverages from her home. She works 12 hours each day, and can attend to about 25 customers during a workday. She believes that business is going well because her store is located along a popular street, and because she is kind and attentive to her customers.

Luz is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, which will help her to purchase a door for her home and to operate her business from inside her home, as opposed to out on the street nearby. She also will use the support to purchase beer and other merchandise, so that she can offer a wider variety of products to her customers and increase her income. She hopes to continue working toward her dream of having a large, thriving store.

loans.use: to purchase a new door for her home and merchandise for her business (beer).

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre muy trabajador, es padre de u hijo de 12 años de edad al cual quiere muchísimo y por el cual trabaja muy duro para salir adelante, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo es visitada por infinidad de turistas ya que allí se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina, asimismo en una ciudad donde se realiza la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago y uva. En su tiempo libre a Juan le gusta arreglar cosas es muy ingenioso por ello siempre se distrae de esa manera, asimismo le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos que son los “Tallarines Rojos”.

Día a Día Juan trabaja en su negocio de elaboración de Estructuras metálicas y mantenimiento de vidrios templados, el se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 3 clientes al día según el tamaño de los pedidos; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y cumplido con los pedidos que le hacen.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar fibra de vidrio para las estructuras al por mayor y así mejorar sus ingresos y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo, lo que le permitirá seguir adelante y luchar para hacer cumplir su mas grande sueño: “Tener una cadena de vidrierías”.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking man and the father of a 12-year-old son whom he loves very much. Juan works very hard to get ahead and to provide for his son. His home is located in Ica, a city that is known for its hot climate and as a major tourist attraction, since it is home to the famous Huacachina lagoon. Ica is an agricultural city, with an emphasis on the cultivation of cotton, asparagus and grapes. In his free time, Juan like to fix things, and is a very handy man. He also enjoys eating one of his favorites dishes, “Tallarines Rojos” (red pasta).

Juan works every day in his metal working business, where he also tempers glass. He works about 10 hours per day, and can complete projects for three clients each day, depending on the size and complexity of their orders. He believes that business is going so well because he is very responsible and follows through on projects for his clients.

Juan is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, which will help him to purchase fiberglass for use in various projects and structures for wholesale. This will allow him to improve his income and quality of life for his son, and will help him towards fulfilling his dream of establishing a chain of glass and metal workshops.

loans.use: to purchase fiberglass.

loans.name: Tiofilo Moises

texts.es:
Moises en un hombre muy trabajador y optimista, vive junto a su pareja y su hijo de 4 añitos el cual es su adoración a pesar que es muy travieso y le saca canas verdes, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo es visitada por infinidad de turistas ya que allí se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina, asimismo en una ciudad donde se realiza la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago y uva. Cuando Moises tiene un tiempo libre le gusta leer libros para distraerse y así como también le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo: “Escabeche de Pollo”.

Con mucha alegría y entusiasmo Moises trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos para el hogar, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y atento con los clientes.

Moises está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá  mercadería para su negocio como accesorios para cocinas, .lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos para así seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad su gran sueño.” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y una mejor calidad de Vida”.
texts.en:
Moises is a very optimistic and hardworking man who lives with his partner and their 4-year-old son, whom they adore even though he is very mischievous. His home is located in Ica, a city that is known for its hot climate and as a major tourist attraction, since it is home to the famous Huacachina lagoon. Ica is an agricultural city, with an emphasis on the cultivation of cotton, asparagus and grapes. In his free time, Moises likes to read books, and also enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, the delicious, “Escabeche de Pollo” (marinated chicken).

Moises has a joyful and enthusiastic work ethic, and dedicates approximately 8 hours per day to his business selling home accessories and products. He can assist up to 20 clients each day, and he believes that business is going so well because he is very friendly and attentive to his clients.

Moises is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, which will help him purchase merchandise for his business, such as kitchen accessories. This support will allow him to offer a wider variety of products to his clients, and will improve his income, allowing him to continue working each day towards his goal of giving his son an education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (kitchen accessories).

loans.name: Luzmila Albina

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 46 años de edad, pero es se siente como una joven de 20 ya que es muy alegre y entusiasta, es madre de un pequeño de 1 año de edad al que ama muchísimo y es su razón de vivir día a día, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro de paracas, lugares turísticos que reciben infinidad de personas para apreciar su belleza y esplendor, también se le conoce por la amabilidad de su gente y por sus actividades principales como la pesca y la agricultura. En su tiempo libre a Luzmila le gusta salir a pasear con su pequeño y sobre todo preparar su platillo favorito el cual es el “Arroz con Pollo”.

Luzmila trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella se dedica alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y es muy conocida.

Luzmila está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar mas ropa para su negocio, lo que permitirá que tenga mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:2 Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 46 years old, though she feels as young and enthusiastic as a 20-year-old. She is the mother of a 1-year-old son whom she loves very much, and who is her inspiration. Her home is located in Pisco, a city that is known for the Ballestas Islands, inhabited by seals and penguins, and for the Paracas Candelabra, a mysterious and famous geoglyph in the desert sands nearby. Both of these are major tourist attractions, receiving countless visitors each year as people come to appreciate the beauty and splendor of the area. The region is also known for its friendly people, who work in the fishing and agriculture industries.  

In her free time, Luzmila likes to go out and walk a bit, and she also enjoys eating one of her favorite dishes, “Arroz con Pollo” (chicken with rice). Luzmila has a clothing sales business, and she dedicates about 10 hours per day to her work, attending up to 30 clients in a day. She believes that business is going so well because she is very friendly and is well known.

Luzmila is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, which will help her to purchase more clothing for her business. This in turn will allow her to offer a greater variety to her customers and increase her income, helping her to continue working towards her dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothing).

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a 26-year-old married man living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and to build a permanent home.

Prossy has been operating a hardware business for the last two years. His major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase enough stock to meet the high demand. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and expanding his business to new markets. Prossy needs a loan to buy cement and iron sheets for resale.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron sheets for resale.

loans.name: Elba Alicia

texts.es: Elba Alicia tiene sesenta y un años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y  nieto el cual se encuentra estudiando. Ella se dedica al comercio de productos de belleza tales como: variedad de lociones, cremas, champo, maquillaje, y de mas artículos que son atractivos para los clientes. Es una mujer muy emprendedora la cual trabaja duramente para colaborar con los ingresos del hogar y poder llevar un poco de dinero que le permita suplir algunas necesidades. Posee un puesto en el mercado Municipal de la zona donde ella habita el cual es  muy transitado. Ha luchado mucho para poder mantener a flote su negocio ya que la competencia siempre está presente y es lo que la hace mantenerse siempre atenta por mejorar. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más  ya que es una mujer muy positiva y honrada en su trabajo. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este credito a INTEGRAL por que quiere invertir en su negocio en la compra de nueva mercadería (lociones, cremas, champo, maquillaje, etc.) que le permita mantener su negocio surtido y estar al día de los nuevos productos que van saliendo en el mercado. Para que de esta forma pueda seguir llamando la atención de una gran variedad de clientes que le permitan mejorar sus ganancias y que le den la oportunidad de ingresar a una mejor calidad de vida. Ella expresa estar muy agradecida con esta institución ya que en el pasado le brindaron ayuda cuando más lo necesitaba, fue así como su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Espera poder obtener  resultados favorables en esta nueva oportunidad.
texts.en:
Elba Alicia is sixty-one years old and lives in her own house with her husband and also her grandson, who is in school.  She is involved in the sales of beauty products including: a variety of lotions, creams, shampoo, makeup, and other items which her customers enjoy.  She is a very entrepreneurial woman who works hard to contribute to the household income and to be able to raise a little money so she can provide some necessities.

She has a location in the municipal market in the zone where she lives that is quite busy.  She has really struggled to keep her business afloat since there has always been great competition, and this makes her always attentive to improving her business.  She has been doing this for many years, so she already has many faithful customers who choose her every day because she is a very positive woman and honorable in her work.  She has chosen to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL because she wishes to invest in her business by buying new merchandise (lotions, creams, shampoo, makeup, etc.) which will help her to keep her business well-stocked and be up to date with the newest products that come on the market.  This is how she will be able to continue attracting the attention of a variety of customers, which will help her increase her margins and will give her the opportunity to create a better sort of life.  

She says that she is very thankful for this institution because they gave her help when she most needed it, that's how her business has been growing, little by little.  She hopes to get good results from this new investment opportunity.

loans.use: to buy lotions, beauty creams, shampoo, makeup, etc.

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Twibumbirehamwe/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Beatrice fait partie du groupe Twibumbirehamwe. Elle a 30 ans, elle est mariée avec 3 enfants de 2 ans à 10 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Beatrice est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées et des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Beatrice voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Beatrice is part of the group Twibumbirehamwe. She is 30 years old and married, and she has three children, from 2 to 10 years old. Two of the children are in school. She has one person to support other than her children. She has a 6th grade education. 

Beatrice is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is her third one with the microfinance institution ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

Her strategy for the growth of her business is to use select seeds and chemical fertilizers for her rice farming. 

In the next few years, Beatrice would like to be the No. 1 farmer in the region. With the profits, she plans on educating her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Urpicha II, tiene 53 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida, es madre de 6 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años, ella nota que su vida esta cambiando tanto económicamente como personal, y ella lo agradece a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal, para ella FINCA Perú es una organización que ayuda a las mujeres a progresar. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de arroz,azúcar, aceite para su negocio.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Communal Bank "Urpicha II". She is 53 years old and the mother of six children. Eugenia sells food and has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years. She says that her life has changed financially and personally. Eugenia is grateful for the training classes she received from the Communal Bank. For her, FINCA Peru is an organization that helps women make progress.

The loan she is requesting now will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, and oil for her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Abesamihigo A /rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo A. Il a 53 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 10 ans à 33 ans, dont 6 scolarises. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Jean Bosco est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is part of the group Abesamihigo. He is 53 years old and married, and he has six children, from 10 to 33 years old. All of them have had schooling. He has one person to support other than his children. He has 3 years of secondary education. 

Jean Bosco is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his third one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use select seeds. In the next few years, Jean Bosco would like to be the No. 1 farmer in the region. With the profits, she plans on educating his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Abunzubumwe/ Kzh Group

texts.fr:
Torojani fait partie du groupe Abunzubumwe /Kzh. Il a 39 ans, il est marie avec 7 enfants de 1 an à 15 ans, dont 4scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.
Trojani est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Trojani voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Torojani is part of the group Abunzubumwe /Kzh. He is 39 years old and married, and he has 7 children, from 1 to 15 years old. Four of the children are in school. He has six years of secondary education. 

Torojani is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his third one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use select seeds. In the next few years, Torojani would like to be the No. 1 farmer in the region. With the profits, he plans on covering his children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Abaticamugambi/ Rhh Group

texts.fr:
Vénusté fait partie du groupe Abaticumugambi. Il a 46 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 2 an à 9 ans, dont 1 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de secondaire.
Vénusté est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Vénusté voudrait être le grossiste des riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants et payer le frais médicaux.
texts.en:
Vénusté is part of the group Abaticumugambi. He is 46 years old and married, and he has four children, from 2 to 9 years old. He has five years of secondary education. 

Vénusté is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his second one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use select seeds. In the next few years, Vénusté would like to be the wholesale merchant of rice. With the profits, he plans on covering his children's schooling and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
This is Leona, 44, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Demetrio, a driver, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Leona operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver meat to market stalls. Her products are pork, beef meat and processed meat products. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies of pork and beef meat needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Leona hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and be finished with their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of meat needed in her business

loans.name: Twitekumurimo Group

texts.fr:
Emile fait partie du groupe Twitekumurimo. Il a 29 ans, il est marie avec 3 enfants de 3 an à 8 ans, dont 1 scolarise. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.
Emile est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Emile voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants
texts.en:
Emile is part of the group Twitekumurimo. He is 29 years old and married, and he has three children, from 3 to 8 years old. He has one person to support other than his children. He has six years of secondary education. 

Emile is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his third one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use select seeds. In the next few years, Emile would like to be the No. 1 farmer in his region. With the profits, he plans on covering his children's schooling expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Tezimberigihugu Group

texts.fr:
Germain fait partie du groupe Tezimberigihugu. Il a 45 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 6 ans à 18 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Germain est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser les semences sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Germain voudrait être un grand producteur riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Germain is part of the group Tezimberigihugu. He is 45 years old and married, and he has six children, from 6 to 18 years old. He has a 6th grade education. 

Germain is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his third one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use select seeds. In the next few years, Germain would like to be a major rice producer in his region. With the profits, he plans on covering his children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Maria Liliana

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 35 años de edad, conviviente con 3 hijos a su cargo, y vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el caserío Guaraguaos Alto, en el distrito de Tambogrande, en la zona rural, pero si cuenta con servicio de luz eléctrica.
La actividad a la que se dedica María es a la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora y de piqueos, los cuales puede repartir a domicilio, contando con clientela establecida para los dos negocios. Su conviviente es trabajador estable en un fundo de uva en Ica.
El monto del crédito es de 700 soles, los cuales se utilizarán para la mejora de la infraestructura de su negocio, para verse más vistoso, y atraiga muchos más clientes para el consumo de sus productos y por ende, para ayudar al mejoramiento de su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old.  She lives with her partner and is raising three children.  She lives in her own home, which is located in the hamlet of Guaraguaos Alto, in the district of Tambogrande.  It is in a rural area but it does get electric light service.

María makes a living making and selling chicha de jora (an ancestral drink of the Americas and a national drink of Peru, consisting of fermented corn)  and traditional snacks, which can be delivered to homes.  She relies on her established clientele for both businesses.  Her partner has a stable job at a vineyard in Ica.

The amount of the loan is 700 soles, which they will use to improve the infrastructure of their business, to make it more colorful, and to attract many more customers for the consumption of their products and as a result, to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of her business.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité surge gracias a las promociones hechas en lo zona a las miembros, quienes quedaron encantadas con el programa y decidieron unirse, para que de esa forma puedan trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La sra. Irene, es la presidenta del grupo. Ella junto con su familia tienen una mini microempresa que es la venta y cría de chanchos. Comenta que gracias a este trabajo su familia ha podido salir adelante y ayudarse los unos a los otros. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y que de esa forma su familia pueda tener lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus chanchos, ya que no quiere que les falte para su alimento. Ella agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank came about thanks to the promoting done in the member’s neighborhood. They were pleased with the program and decided to join together so that they could work together and help each other out. 

Irene is the president of the group. She and her family have a small business, which is selling and raising pigs. She explains that it is thanks to this work that her family has been able to get ahead and help each other. Her goal is to continue growing so that her family can have what it needs day to day.

She is requesting the loan to buy commercial feed for her pigs because she doesn’t want them to lack for food. She is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the help she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las emprendedoras es un excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, está integrado por 12 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Actualmente se encuentran en el tercer ciclo, pero su meta es seguir trabajando juntas y de esa forma ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La presidenta del grupo es la Sra. Epifania, quien se dedica a la venta de verduras y nos comenta que con este trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día. Su meta es agrandar su negocio y de esa forma poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas, pepinas y demás verduras, lo que le ayudará a tener bien surtido su negocio. El grupo está muy agradecido con la fundación paraguaya y con Kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Women group is an excellent group of women in the city of Itá. It is made up of 12 women, all of whom are friends and neighbors from this city. Currently, they are in their third loan cycle, but their goal is to continue working together and, in this way, to help each other out. 

The president of the group is Epifania, who sells vegetables. She explains to us that with this work she has been able to support her family and give them what they need day to day. Her goal is to expand her business so that she can offer a greater variety to her customers.

She is requesting the loan to buy tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, cucumbers, and other vegetables, which will help her to have her business well stocked. The group is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, cucumbers, and other vegetables

loans.name: Nereah

texts.en:
Nereah is a 53-year-old woman from Migori. She is married to Raphael and they have seven children.

She sells charcoal, a business she has done for the last five years, getting a monthly income of KES 7,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy more stock of charcoal to sell. She will use the profits to boost her charcoal stock.

Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To  buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Las Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
Las Virtuosas se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual presidenta la Sra. Delia contactó con la asesora en una reunión que tenía en la zona para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité. Actualmente el grupo tiene 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando en el primer ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Mariana es parte del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de joyas de todo tipo, como ser anillos, pulseras, cadenas y demás tipos. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre recibe muchos pedidos de sus clientes., y es por ello que le va muy bien.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas con lo que podrá abastecerse y tener mayor variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Está muy contenta por esta oportunidad de progreso que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The “Las Virtuosas” group is a good group of women in the city of Itá. The current president, Delia, contacted the advisor in a meeting that took place in the neighborhood and informed herself of the work that the Committee does. Currently the group has 17 women, who are working on their first loan cycle together in a supportive way within the program. 

Mariana is a part of the group. She sells jewelry of all sorts, such as rings, bracelets, chains, and other things. She says that she has a good clientele because she always gets a lot of orders from her customers, and this is why things are going very well for her.

She is requesting the loan to buy jewelry so that she can stock up and have a greater variety to offer to her customers. She is very happy because of the opportunity for progress that she is receiving, because it will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  Nueva Esperanza está formado por 9 socias quienes son mujeres hospitalarias, amables y de un corazón muy cálido, laboran en diferentes actividades, trabajos que le permiten solventar sus gastos personales y sacar adelante a sus familias para brindarles un mejor futuro. Viven por distintos lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta ciudad esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gran variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus habitantes y de sus visitantes, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Baltazara, tiene 45 años, es viuda y no tiene hijos, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. María Baltazara trabaja en una marisquería desde hace algunos años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. En su casa cría vacas, cerdos y pollos a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.

Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir comprando pollos y alimento para los mismos.
 
Su meta es crecer en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” comunal bank is made up of 9 members who are hospitable and friendly women who have warm hearts. They work in different businesses, work which allows them to cover their personal expenses and help their families get ahead so they can provide them with a better future. They live in different areas of the city of Cuenca, which has been a World Heritage site since December 1999. This city is bathed by 4 rivers, its huge variety of cuisine captivates the palates of its inhabitants and visitors, and its residents preserve the culture and traditions of their peoples.

One of the members of this group is María Baltazara. She is 45 years old, a widow, and does not have children. The house she lives in is her own property.

María Baltazara has worked in a seafood restaurant for a few years. She works from Sunday to Sunday from 8:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon. At home she raises cows, pigs, and chickens, which she sells when has economic need. 

She is in her third loan cycle with the communal bank and she is going to use it to buy chickens and feed for them. 

Her goal is to grow her animal raising business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed for them

loans.name: Carlos Ivan
