She is now servicing her fifth loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD after she paid her previous loans successfully. She intends to use this amount to pay the milk suppliers and purchase more milk cans for holding the milk.  

The anticipated profit will be used for her family's upkeep.  She hopes for a successful business and a bright future.

loans.use: To pay the milk suppliers and purchase milk cans.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a thirty-two-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house. He has been a farmer for the last twenty years and saved money which he used to buy his own land from his salary earned as a sub county chief. 

He is facing challenges of customers and unpredictable seasonal weather variations; however, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include crop production, hiring employees to help expand his business and moving his business to a more permanent location. Robert needs a loan to expand his banana plantation.

loans.use: to expand his banana plantation.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa, 31, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Nestor, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.              
               
Marissa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells ready to wear clothes for additional income.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marissa hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a thirty-year-old man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent house. He is a personnel officer at a factory and is facing a hardship of poor payments. However, he has a vision of venturing into agriculture. Fred intends to use the loan to buy land for crop growing.

loans.use: to buy land for crop growing.

loans.name: Hassane

texts.en:
Hassane is a 30-year-old married man with two children. He works at doing necessary maintenance to heaters and air conditioners. This kind of business faces a high working season during the spring and summer seasons, and that's why he has to be ready with the necessary hardware and spare parts that might be needed for most machines he might fix.

To do so, Hassane applied for a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, and he hopes to keep on improving his business. Hassane has 22 years of experience in this field. He was only eight years old when he started to learn this business, and now he's an expert in his field.

Hassane is working hard to expand his business in order to provide his children and family with a good and healthy life.

loans.use: To support his business with necessary hardware.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu is a married woman with 4 children, and all are attending school. She operates a shop and also sells vegetables as her side business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Most of her customers buy goods on credit, which poses a challenge to her. However, she aims at opening a wholesale business in the near future. With the KES 20,000, she intends to purchase maize flour. Saumu’s major expenses during the month are school fees and food. She joined Yehu to get cheap loans.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour.

loans.name: Leatitia

texts.en: Leatitia is 36 years old. She is a widow with two children, ages 8 and 14, both of whom are enrolled in school. She has decided to ask for a loan to buy more peanuts and fish to sell. With the profits, she plans to make savings and provide for the family.

loans.use: To buy more fish and peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Jones

texts.en:
Jones is an 81-year-old lady. She is married to James and together they have five children who are all grownups.

She has been selling dry maize for the last six years, earning a monthly income of about KES 8,000. This is her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more sacks of dry maize to sell. 

She will use the profits to plow back into the business. Her dream is to build a good house.

loans.use: To buy more dry maize to sell.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a thirty-three-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a management trainee and has just begun his career.

In order to supplement his meager salary, he wishes to venture into agriculture. Joshua intends to buy land with the loan.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 52-year-old married father of eight children. Ahmad has 25 years of experience in the construction contracting industry, retailing various building materials such as concrete, iron and wood. Ahmad is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business supply of iron and wood which will contribute to his business revenue.

Dedicating all his life to his family, Ahmad also wants to help his son with his marriage expenses. A devoted father, he does not want his son’s limited financial conditions to stand in the way of his happiness. He also plans, in the future, to buy the apartment he is renting to secure a permanent residence for his family.

loans.use: to increase his business supply of iron and wood which will contribute to his business revenue

loans.name: Anelito

texts.en:
This is Anelito, 41, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. His wife is Josephine, the mother of his children. Anelito, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anelito operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Anelito hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and there he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a thirty-year-old married lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goal is building a permanent home and educating children.

She has been selling food for the last five years. Her major hardships are inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock and seasonal weather variations. However, she has a vision of buying land to grow crops. Hawa will buy beans to sell with this loan.

loans.use: to buy beans for resale

loans.name: Marget

texts.en:
Marget is 35 years old, from Migori and is married to Timate.  They have four children.

Marget sells beans, a business she has been doing for four years now earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES per month. This is her fourth loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy more beans. She will be using her profits to buy other types of cereals and to educate her children, and part of it to repay her loan well.

Her dream is to open a big store at the market center.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beans to sell

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
Este grupo Virgen de Fátima, actualmente se encuentran en el 3° ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras con 13 integrantes, son un grupo de mujeres muy responsables y trabajadoras., todas cuentan con actividades emprendedoras y ayudan a sus familias a salir adelante. 
La Sra Blanca tiene 36 años, casada y tiene 6 hijos. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de remedios yuyos en mazos que ella misma con la ayuda de sus hijos va a buscar en los montes y bosques de sus alrededores, además ella también compra los remedios en sobres que los vuelve a vender. Ella es una persona muy humilde y sacrificada y cuenta que aunque tenga que trabajar mucho no le importa porque todo lo que hace es por sus hijos. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remedios en sobres, con lo cual podrá seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes
texts.en: This group, Virgen de Fátima, is currently in its third loan cycle with Mujeres Emprendedoras. Its 13 members are all very responsible and hardworking women. They each have a business with which they help their family to survive. Blanca is 36 years old, married with 6 children. She buys and sells herbal remedies in bunches that she gathers herself from the surrounding mountains and forests with the help of her children. She also buys remedies in packets and resells them. She is a very humble and devoted person, who tells us that, even though she has to work a lot, she does not mind because it is all for the sake of her children. She asks for this loan to buy remedies in packets, which will enable her to fulfil her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies in packets to sell.

loans.name: Recuerdos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Recuerdos esta integrado por cinco mujeres trabajadoras, amables y muy alegres.
Todas las integrantes de este grupo son originarias de pinotepa nacional Oaxaca  para ellos su comunidad significa  tierra de gente buena y trabajadora.
Una de las  tradiciones de pinotepa nacional es la celebración del día de muertos y la fiesta quinto viernes cuando vienen los juegos  y muchos extranjeros vienen a vender sus artesanías.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora  Maria de  cincuenta y ocho años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una señora alegre, humilde y muy amable.
Doña Mari como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo se dedica a la venta de  calzado por catalogo, vende calzado, para niñas, niños, caballeros y dama, ella nos dice que lo mas le gusta de su negocio es   salir a vender a las calles de su comunidad para que así pueda obtener mas ganancias.
Lo que no le gusta de su negocio es que  ocasiones sus clientas se atrasan en pagarle y es hay donde pierde clientes y se  atrasa en pedir su mercancía.
Uno de sus sueños es tener un pequeño local donde pueda  exhibir su mercancía  y pueda recibirá sus clientes.
Doña Mari nos cuenta uno de sus retos cuales le impiden en ocasiones no seguir con su negocio uno de sus retos es que  a veces se le termina el dinero para pedir mas  mercancía  y sus clientes se molestan por que su calzado no llega a tiempo y eso la hace sentir triste ya que no le comprende que necesita dinero para invertir y tener calzado extra para  que haber si alguno de sus clientes le gusta ese calzado y se lo pueda comprar y el cliente se vaya contento ya que tiene dos calzados a cuales elegir.
Doña Mari nos dice que también se dedica a la venta de  perfumes americanos ya que su hijo le manda perfumes para que ella los pueda vender y así tener un dinero extra.
Doña Mari esta felizmente casada con el señor  cirio  con quien tiene  cinco hijos quienes ya están casados sus hijos se llaman  Daniel,Fidel,Fabiola,isirino y Jorge quienes  quieren mucho a su madre y le ayudan en lo que puedan.
Doña Pidió el crédito para la compra de mas calzado  para dama, niño, niña y caballero.
Ella nos dice que le da las gracias a fundación por  darle la oportunidad de salir adelante y así mejorar su calidad de vida y engrandecer su negocio.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Eva Felicisima- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Consuelo – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Marcelina- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Margarita- se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
 Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a la gente buena y trabajadora con deseos de mejorar sus vidas  y tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
This group, called Recuerdos (Memories), is made of five hard-working, friendly, and happy women.  All of the members of this group are natives of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.  For them, their community means land of good and hard-working people.  One of the traditions of Pinotepa Nacional is the celebration of Day of the Dead and the Fiesta Quinto Viernes when the games arrive and many foreigners come to sell their crafts.  

One of the members of this group is Señora Maria, 58 years old, who is known for being a happy, humble, and very friendly woman.  Doña Mari, as she is better known by her partners in the group, makes a living selling footwear from a catalog.  She sells footwear for boys, girls, men, and women.  She tells us that what she likes most about her business is going out and selling in the streets of her community so that she can get more profits.  What she doesn't like about her business is that sometimes her customers are slow to pay her, and this is where she loses customers and falls behind in ordering her goods.  

One of her dreams is to have a small place where she can exhibit her goods and be able to meet her clients.  Doña Mari tells us one of her challenges, which at times makes it difficult to continue with her business, is that sometimes she runs out of money for ordering more goods and her customers get upset because the footwear does not arrive on time. This makes her feel sad since they do not understand that she needs money in order to invest and to have extra footwear so that if one of her customers likes a shoe and she is able to get it the customer would go away happy since they have two shoes to choose from.  Doña Mari says that she also makes a living selling American perfumes because her son orders perfumes so that she can sell them and thus have extra money.  

Doña Mari is happily married to Señor Cirio with whom she has five children who are already married.  Her children are named Daniel, Fidel, Fabiola, Isirino, and Jorge.  They love their mother very much and help her in whatever way they are able.  She asked for the loan so that she can buy more footwear for women, boys, girls, and men.  She tells us that she gives thanks to the Foundation for giving her the opportunity to get ahead and thus improve her quality of life and increase her business.  

The other members of the group are:
Eva Felicisima - Makes a living selling footwear.
Consuelo - Makes a living selling Mexican snacks.
Marcelina - Makes a living selling footwear.
Margarita - Makes a living selling perfumes.

They give thanks to the Foundation for helping the good and hard-working people with their wishes to improve their lives and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen, a 34-year-old married mother of five children, lives in Kasese, Uganda where she has been in the bar and lodging business for seven years. She is requesting this loan to buy more beer and soda to sell.

Allen's hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and customers not paying on time. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent home, while her business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding her business into new markets and hiring employees to help with the expansion.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy coffee plants for cultivation.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 35-year-old gentleman who is married and deals in a cattle business that he has run for eight years. 

He got his initial capital from farming, which was his primary activity. He says inadequate capital is affecting the business. He wants a loan to buy cattle for resale.

Jackson would like to educate his children and expand his business to new markets.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 41-year-old married lady. 

She owns a nursery school in Ndumberi. She has been in the business for five years now and earns a monthly income of 7,500 KES.

This will be her  second  loan with KADET Ltd. She plans use the entire loan to buy more desks and chairs. She will use her profit  to build more classrooms. In the future she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more desks and chairs.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
This is Alexander, a 31-year-old resident of Puerto Princesa, Palawan, Philippines. Single, he manages his household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Alexander operates a salon business offering hair styling and hair grooming services. With his salon adjacent to his house, his regular customers are neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, Alexander is requesting a Php 30,000 loan to buy supplies including shampoo and hair treatment creams and oils. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Alexander, who hopes to venture into the pastry business, faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of salon supplies and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is a hard-working 45-year-old lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goal is to build a permanent house. She has been dealing in the clothing selling business for the last ten years. She started this business with her personal savings acquired from animal rearing. She faces hardships of price fluctuations and high transportation costs, however, she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets. Kate needs a loan to help her buy traditional clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes for resale.

loans.name: Askah

texts.en: Askah is a 40-year-old married woman. She has a son who is 6 years old. She describes herself as honest. She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, kale, and mangoes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located within a fast-growing slum area and her primary customers are local residents within the slum. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more fruits. Her business goal is to be a supplier of only vegetables within five years. She hopes that in the future, she can use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fruits.

loans.name: Mukai

texts.en: Mukai is a 30-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from seven months to three years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail store where she sells spare parts. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located within a fast-growing slum area and her primary customers are local residents within the slum. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the business. She will use the loan of KES 10,000 to purchase scrap metal. Her business goal is to grow her business to become a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy kilograms of scap metal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 40-year-old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children.

She has been dealing in clothes selling for the last 12 years and her main hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock since the demand is very high.

However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets. 

Edith wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
This is Arlyn, 31, a resident of Puerto Princesa, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Abner, her business partner, and is the mother of their four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.    
                         
Arlyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located near the main street. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

She also operates a fishing boat for additional income. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages and for the maintenance of their boat. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Arlyn hopes to grow her business and acquire another vehicle. She dreams to be able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items for her store and maintenance for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a 45-year-old single mother with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been dealing in clothes for 20 years. She started with 800,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings as working capital.

Her hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. Her personal goals are educating her children and buying a car. Her business goal is to expand her business into new markets.

Marjorie wants money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 50-year-old married lady. She has a cereals shop and has been in the business for three years now. She gets a monthly income of KES 18,000. 

This will be her first loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to increase stock by buying two sacks of beans, one sack of black beans and one sack of green grams (mung beans). 

In the future she wants to be able to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy  two sacks of beans, one sack of black beans and one sack of green grams.

loans.name: Jones

texts.en:
Jones is a 44-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has been in a retail shop business for eight years. He got capital from his salary savings as a courier. 

His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital. His personal goals are educating his children and his business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding his business into new markets.

Jones wants money to buy sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a married woman with seven children, all in school. She operates a greengrocery and has been doing so for the last three years. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings she requested, she will be able to buy sacks of vegetables. Other sources of income include her husband’s earnings. She wants to open another greengrocery. Most of her monthly income goes to school fees and food. Fatuma joined Yehu because it cares for its clients.

loans.use: to buy sacks of vegetables

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children, three of whom are in school. She does not take care of additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of tomatoes, onions, and watermelon. Her major business challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goal is to buy a plot of land and start growing fruits and vegetables, and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, and watermelon

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is 48 years old, married, and has three children. He has been running his own car repairs business for 28 years and is well-known for his courtesy, fine finishing, and reasonable prices. 

Maher is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to purchase spare parts.  To boost his business, he needs to ensure the constant availability of parts. 

Maher’s harsh circumstances forced him into this business. In his youth, his older brother died and he had to leave university to assist his father with the household expenses. Thus, Maher is determined to educate his children, one of whom is now at university level.  Since his expenses are expected to rise, in the future, Maher plans to expand his scope of work to involve car trades.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his business

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 49-year-old, married father of two children. He has been running a menswear store for 17 years now. Mazen has been successful in this business due to the unique clothes he sells, his competitive and market-responsive prices, and his excellent attitude toward his customers.

Mazen is applying for a loan with Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua, to finance his store’s clothing purchases. He aims to expand the business and grow more revenues to eventually open up his own shop. Mazen has devoted all his life to his family. Through owning his own business, he is able to secure a permanent source of income to maintain a good standard of living for them.

loans.use: to finance his store’s clothing purchases.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 34-year-old, married man with two children, ages 4 and 10. He describes himself as an aggressive and focused man. 

Bernard operates a retail stall where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. His business is located along a busy shopping center, and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate funding for improving his business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy shoes to sell. Bernard's dream and business goal is to run several retail shoe stores within five years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for selling.

loans.name: Refaat

texts.en:
Refaat is a 34-year-old, married father of two children. Four years ago, he opened his own grocery store, where he sells foodstuffs and candies. Refaat’s business evolved quickly since then as he has been the only shop-owner in the area. 

Running his business as a one-man-show, Refaat deals directly with wholesalers. To save time and costs, he recently bought a car to enable him to drive  to his various providers. He is applying for a loan with Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for the registration of his vehicle so he can begin using it. In reducing his expenses, Refaat can accumulate more savings for himself and his family and even consider expansion plans in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the registration of his vehicle he will use for his business.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all her children are in school. She does not take care of additional family members. She sells Cavendish bananas on both a retail and wholesale basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches and clusters of Cavendish bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goal is to buy a plot of land and build her own house and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches and clusters of Cavendish bananas

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en:
Bassima is a 55-year-old married mother of two children. She has owned a beauty salon for 15 years now, offering hairdressing and makeup services and selling skin-care products and perfumery. 

Bassima’s vast experience in the field makes her aware of its competitiveness. Thus, she is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua to expand and diversify her business. With the money, Bassima will enhance her services by using and offering higher quality products, as well as broadening the range of her offerings to beauty treatments and facials.

loans.use: to expand and diversify her business

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 39-year-old, married father of four children. For years, he has been working in the spare-parts retail business until last year when he began running a small coffee shop. Salah intends to expand his business by selling other goods such as foodstuffs and candies. For this purpose, he is applying for a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua.

Salah is always looking for better sources of income to finance his household’s increasing needs. He is committed to providing a good standard of living for his family, starting with buying an apartment. Therefore, Salah is keen on seizing revenue-generating opportunities.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and candies to sell.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 29-year-old, married woman. She has one daughter who is 7 years old. She describes herself as a visionary and dedicated woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as kale, onions, cabbages, etc. She has been involved in this business for one year. 

Her business is located near many estates, and her primary customers are residents within the estates. She describes her biggest business challenge as having inadequate funds to expand her grocery store. 

Priscilla will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables for selling. Priscilla's business goal is to run many more grocery stores.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits for selling.

loans.name: Dukore / Sk Group

texts.fr:
Richard fait partie du groupe Dukore/ zz. Il a 33 ans, il est marie avec 2 enfants de 6 an à 13 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Richard est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Richard voudrait être professionnel pour la culture  des riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants et payer le frais médicaux.
texts.en:
Richard belongs to the Dukore/ zz group. He is 33 years old, married, and has two children. They are aged 6 and 13, and both of them go to school. Richard attended school for 6 years at the primary level.
He grows rice. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use the loan to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay labor costs.
His strategy for expanding his business is to carefully select the rice seed that he uses. Over the next few years, Richard would like to become a professional in the area of rice growing. With the profit, he plans to pay his children's school fees, and pay for medical costs.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Zulfizar

texts.ru: Зулфизар 38 лет.   В 2010 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Зулфизар начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания со стартовой суммой в 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Зулфизар сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Зулфизар  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  Планы на будущее -  развитие бизнеса за счет открытия магазина, а в семье – Зулфизар  хотела бы усыновить ребенка.
texts.en:
Zulfizar is 38 years old. In 2010, in seeking a source of income for her family, Zulfizar started her own business in the food trade ith the starting amount of 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistence and hard work, Zulfizar was able to develop her business with a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS). 

Today, the product range is not abundant and, for this reason, Zulfizar appealed to the company "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS). Her plans for the future include development of the business by opening a store, and in her family, Zulfizar would like to adopt a child.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, ya tiene experiencia en la labor y sus cosechas son de las más vendidas en la zona,es una persona que cuando entra la temporada de sembrar desde muy temprano se dirige hacia el sitio en que tiene el terreno que cultiva e inicia a realizar sus labores, limpieza del terreno, preparación de la tierra, siembra el grano y lo cuida por lo menos algunos tres meses afanosamente, para lograr obtener una cosecha de primera, es así como últimamente ha aumentado la demanda de su producto, pues es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable la clientela siempre queda satisfecha; Francisco es un hombre emprendedor, responsable y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante, piensa que el éxito es la utilización máxima de la habilidad que tienes, él ha puesto la suya en práctica y con mucho ánimo le ha solicitado a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz de primera calidad, abonos y controladores de plaga. Francisco tiene gran confianza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Francisco, 43, lives with his life partner and their children.  He is a farmer who cultivates corn.  He has a lot of experience in this line of work, and his products are best-sellers in the area.  He is a person who, once the planting season arrives, gets up very early to go out to his fields and start his work clearing the fields, preparing the land and planting the seeds.  He then cares diligently for the crops for at least 3 months so that he can get a top quality harvest.  This is how lately he has increased the demand for his products; they are of very good quality and he sells them at affordable prices.  In addition, he provides unequalled service to his customers, always leaving them satisfied.  Francisco is an enterprising man who is very responsible and has a great desire to get ahead.  He thinks that success is fully utilizing his skills, and he has put them to work with a lot of enthusiasm.  He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy top quality corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.  Francisco has great confidence that in this way, he will be able to bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy corn seed at wholesale, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Progresando Juntos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Progresando Juntos” está conformado por 16 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de lencería, preparación de comida rápida, preparación de comidas típicas chilenas, perfumería y bazar, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo.
Erna presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la última fila de pié, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha. Ella usa su cabello tomado, además viste una polera manga corta, color negro.
Se dedica a vender ropa nueva y también confecciona ropa. Se desempeña en éste negocio desde hace 12 años.
Su mercadería la vende en un puesto que instala en el centro de su misma comuna. Ahí trabaja junto a su madre, quien se encarga de vender directamente sus productos. El horario de trabajo es de lunes a sábado durante todo el día.
Una vez a la semana se encarga de comprar la mercadería que necesita en distribuidoras al por mayor.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para la temporada de invierno, específicamente buzo y calzas deportivas, además de tela de polar para confeccionar ropa.
Una de sus metas, sería contar con un local establecido.
Erna vive junto a su esposo, sus dos hijos de 24 y 18 años edad, quienes estudian. Por lo que uno de sus sueños en el ámbito familiar es que sus hijos sean profesionales. Además obtener una vivienda propia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad económica brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además disfruta de las reuniones del banco comunal junto al grupo, ya que son muy unidos y responsables. 
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called "Progresando Juntos" (Progressing Together) and consists of 16 entrepreneurs who engage in different businesses such as selling lingerie, preparing fast food, preparing traditional Chilean food, managing a perfume shop and bazaar, and other ventures. All of the members are from the community of San Bernardo.

Erna is the president of this Communal Bank group. In the photograph, she is standing in the last row in the first position from left to right. She has her hair pulled back and is wearing a short-sleeved black shirt. Erna sells new clothing, but she also makes garments. She has been in this business for 12 years. Her merchandise is sold from a stand located in the central part of her community. There she works with her mother, who is in charge of handling direct sales. Her work schedule is from Monday to Saturday, all day. Once a week, Erna buys the merchandise she needs in bulk from distributors. Her loan will be used to buy winter clothing, especially track suits and athletic shoes. In addition, she will purchase fleece for making garments. One of her goals is to have an established shop.

Erna lives with her husband and two children, ages 24 and 18, who are in school. One of her dreams for her family is to see her children become professionals. She would also like to have a home of her own. Erna is very pleased and grateful for the financial opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza to invest in her business. She also enjoys the Communal Bank meetings with her group because the members are close and responsible.

San Bernardo is a city that is located 18 kilometers due south from the Plaza de Armas in Santiago (the Chilean capital). It is known as the folklore capital since the International Folklore Festival is held there every January. This event highlights the various ethnic groups of the country and musical groups from all over South America gather there. Chilean artisans, as well as those from other countries nearby, also participate in the Traditional Craft Fair. In the month of April, an event called "Abril Cuecas Mil" celebrates the "cueca" (a traditional Chilean dance) throughout the entire community.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing and fleece for making garments.

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
Salman is a 53-year-old married father of five children. He has been in the truck repair business for 25 years where he has developed a competitive knowledge and long-lasting experience despite the logistical difficulties in this industry.

In an effort to support his business, Salman is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua to buy additional spare parts and ensure their permanent availability. 

Salman’s life revolves around his family; his main concern is providing them a good standard of living through guaranteeing a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and ensure their permanent availability.

loans.name: Gedion

texts.en:
Gedion is 32 years old and married to Munyiva. They have one 9-year-old child. Gedion has been operating his motorbike transport business for a period of about 3 years with an income of about 18,000 KES. 

This is his fourth loan in KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous one. Gedion wants to use the loan to repair the motorbike and service it. He hopes to own a fleet of transport vehicles and improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: To repair and service the motorbike

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en: Nduku is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 2 to 22 years. She describes herself to be dedicated and focused. She operates a retail stall where she sells items such as wheat, millet, soya, pumice, etc.. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of items sold. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy wheat, pumice stones, millet, etc.. Her business goal is to venture into a cereal wholesaler shop. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to buy wheat, millet, pumice, etc.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem is 51 years old, married and has three children. He is from Iraq. Since 2010, Kareem has owned a food market, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has a sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

Kareem is requesting a loan for $2,100, which he will use to purchase an electrical generator and showcases to make an advertising light box. He is aiming to gain more profits so that he can provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator and showcases.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, a 56-year-old married mother of four children ranging in age from 28 to 35 years, describes herself as reliable and social. For the past 20 years she has been operating a farm where she cultivates tea and coffee to sell. Her business is located in a densely populated area, and her primary customer is the Kenya Tea Development Agency (KTDA).

Describing her biggest business challenge as delays in payment from KTDA, Susan will use this Kes 20,000 loan to purchase a cow for milking. Her dream and business goal is to buy three more cows.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Twisungane / Rkmbr Group

texts.fr:
Jean de Dieu fait partie du groupe Twisungane /Rkmbr. Il a 46 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 3 an à 16 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Il 2 personnes en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Jean de Dieu est agriculteur de maïs. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est moderniser ses activités d’agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Jean de Dieu voudrait améliore la qualité de  la culture  des maïs dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants et construire une maison pour sa famille.



Reamarque : Le président de ce groupe porte une chemise bleue, il est la deuxième à droite après un premier monsieur qui porte une chemise blanche.
texts.en:
Jean de Dieu belongs to the Twisungane /Rkmbr group. He is 46 years old, married, and has four children aged between 3 and 16. Three of the children go to school. Besides his children, he is responsible for two other people. He attended school for 6 years at the primary level.
Jean grows corn. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use the loan to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay labor costs.
His strategy for expanding his business is to modernize his farming methods. Over the next few years, Jean would like to improve the quality of corn growing in his area. With the profit, he plans to pay his children's school fees, and build a house for his family.



Note:  The president of this group is wearing a blue shirt. He is the second from the right, next to the first man who is wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to pay for chemical fertilizers and labor costs.

loans.name: Claudia Azucena

texts.es: Claudia Azucena es una emprendedora que ha buscado como salir adelante para brindarle a su familia lo mejor, esta emprendedora ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000 en el crédito en el cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos como pantalones, camisas, blúmer, perfumes, crema, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Claudia Azucena is an entrepreneur who has tried to find how to get ahead to give her family the best.  This entrepreneur already has been working with Fundación León 2000 on the loan.  She has shown herself to be a responsible person with a desire for self-improvement.

Currently she is requesting financing to buy products such as pants, shirts, unerwear, perfume, and creams, among other products.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear, perfumes, and creams, among other products.

loans.name: Neemeh

texts.en: Neemeh is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. Since 2010, he has earned a living by running a workshop where he repairs cars and sells spare parts. He has experience in this field, a good reputation and is well know in the areas around his shop. He is requesting $1,500 loan to build a sliding door in his shop, and an advertising light box. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: make a sliding door and an advertising light box.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 24 years old, single and cares for two of his siblings. He is a carpenter who lives and works in Kenya's Githurai area. He has been in this business for the last five years and earns an income of KES. 31,700 per month. He is applying for his first loan, for KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD, to buy carpentry supplies to make beds. He will use the extra profit he earns to grow his business. He hopes to raise a family in future and expand his business into a big workshop.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials to use in making beds.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru: Фаррух проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 20 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Фаррух уже четыре года как занимается торговлей тканей. Он берет кредит для покупки хлопковых и однотонных тканей.
texts.en: Farrukh lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 20 years old, married and has one child.  Farrukh has been involved in selling fabrics for four years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase cotton and single-tone fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase cotton and single-tone fabrics

loans.name: Dieu Plus Fort Limonade 4 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Waldeck est le coordinateur de son groupe Dieu plus fort Limonade 4 & 6. Il habite dans la région de Trou-du-Nord d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.  Il n`est pas marié et Il a 3 enfants. 

Waldeck voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à produits divers. Des autres membres de groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires et des produits cosmetiques.

Waldeck dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteurs constants a cause du chômage. Il dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce pour qu’il achète un moto pour le taxi.
texts.en:
Waldeck is the coordinator of the group "Dieu Plus Fort Limonade 4 & 6".  He lives in the Trou-du-Nord region of Haiti where there is little electricity and limited water.  He is not married and has three children.

Waldeck would like to use this loan to buy various goods.  Other members of his group will be using this loan to purchase food products and cosmetics.

Waldeck says that his main challenge is a lack of consistent customers, because of high unemployment rates.  His dream is to expand his business and to buy a moto-taxi.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El Sr. Julian es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, tiene 36 años, el es comerciante, tiene con un salón comercial donde vende todo tipo de prendas, y cuenta que está ubicado en una zona estratégica de la ciudad.
El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que siempre lucha por poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma tener un mejor ingreso y así mejorar su calidad de vida. 
En vistas a seguir ofreciendo una mejor calidad a sus clientes, solicita el crédito para la compra de uniformes escolares, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por esta oportunidad de progreso que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Julián is from the city of Curuguaty.  He is 36 years old and a storekeeper.  He has a store where he sells all types of garments, and he relies on it being located in a strategic area of the city.

He describes himself as a hardworking and enterprising person who always fights to be able to get ahead and help his family.  His goal is to be able to continue working to have a better income and, in this way, improve his quality of life.

In light of continuing to give his customers better quality, he is requesting the loan to buy school uniforms because he has many orders he would like to be able to fill.

He is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for this opportunity for progress that he is getting.

loans.use: to buy uniforms to sell.

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru:
Уулкан 57 лет, воспитала 4 детей. В качестве основного источника  дохода для своей семьи Уулкан занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес после замужества. Благодаря упорному труду Уулкан ее хозяйство на сегодняшний  день приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов.  Также, Уулкан обрабатывает 1,50 га земли, где выращивает  кукурузу.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить надои  и часть – на полевые расходы.  Доходы от кредита Уулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Uulkan is 57 years old and raised four children.  To provide a primary source of income for her family, Uulkan is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business after getting married.  Thanks to her hard work, today her business yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  Uulkan also works on 1.50 hectares of land where she grows corn.  In order to further develop her business, Uulkan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows, which would allow her to increase milk volumes, and to spend some on farming expenses.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a future increase of domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Khayrulo

texts.ru: Хайруло житель района Фархор. Он женат. Ему 53 года. У него четверо детей. Он занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров и ковров. В этой области Хайруло шесть лет. Он берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Khayrulo is a resident of the Farkhor district.  He is 53 years old, married and has four children.  He is involved in selling household goods and rugs.  Khayrulo has been in this business for six years.  He is requesting this loan to expand his merchandise selection.

loans.use: to purchase necessary merchandise

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 30-year-old married lady with two children. She sells charcoal. She has been in this business for three years now and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more charcoal. In the future she wants to improve the living status of her family and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Peterson Noble

texts.en: Peterson Noble is a 26-year-old hardworking man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children, build a permanent home, and have self-education. He has been in the transportation business for the last five years, after using his personal savings for the business. He is facing hardships of high fuel and transportation costs and inadequate capital. However, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops and expanding his business to new markets. Peterson needs a loan to buy land for growing crops.

loans.use: to buy land for growing crops

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en: Tadeo is a 28-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home. He has been dealing in a shoe-selling business after investing his personal savings in the business. He is facing hardships of price fluctuations, high fuel and transportation costs, and seasonal weather. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas. Tadeo needs a loan to  buy more shoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Vick

texts.en: Vick is a 40-year-old married woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the poultry business for one year. Her hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital. Her personal goals are to educate her children and buy a car. Her business goals are to buy land to grow crops and expand her business into new markets. Vick wants money to buy chickens for rearing.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Pardahol

texts.ru: Пардахол жительница района Шахритус. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее 8 детей. Ее дети учатся в средней школе, а муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Пардахол уже десять лет занимается растениеводством. Она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Pardahol is a resident of the Shahrituz district.  She is 44 years old, married and has eight children.  Her children attend a secondary school, and husband is in the Russian Federation for work.  Pardahol has been involved in agriculture for ten years.  She is requesting this loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат жительница района Шахритус. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Ее муж предоставляет услугу, у него имеется столовая. Сама Малохат три года как занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном она продает детскую одежду и обувь. В торговле ей помогает ее дочь. Она берет кредит для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Malohat is a resident of the Shahrituz district.  She is 39 years old, married and has one child.  Her husband provides a service - he has a cafe.  Malohat has been involved in sales at a market for three years.  She primarily sells children's clothing and shoes.  Her daughter helps her with the sales.  Malohat is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing and shoes

loans.name: Azim

texts.ru: Азим более шести лет работает в пекарне. Он в основном печет лепешки для торговли. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Азим берет кредит для покупки муки.
texts.en: Azim has been working at a bakery for over six years.  He primarily bakes flatbread for sale.  He is 33 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Azim is requesting this loan to purchase flour.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Ahliniso

texts.ru: Ахлинисо проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Ахлинисо занимается торговлей мужской и женской одежды. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 2 года. В торговлей ей помогает ее муж. Она берет кредит для покупки летней мужской одежды.
texts.en: Ahliniso lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 27 years old, married and has one child.  Ahliniso is involved in selling men's and women's clothing.  She has been in this business for two years.  Her husband helps her with the sales.  Ahliniso is requesting this loan to purchase men's summer clothing.

loans.use: to purchase men's summer clothing

loans.name: Shirin

texts.ru:
Ширин 27 лет. В качестве основного источника  дохода для своей семьи, Ширин занимается предоставлением услуг общественного питания, начав этот бизнес в 2010 году. Благодаря упорному труду Ширин,  ее бизнес, начатый с суммы 50,000 сом  позволяет ей иметь  прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) с месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ширин обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку холодильника для прохладительных напитков и мороженого.  Доходы от кредита Ширин планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Shirin is 27 years old.  To provide a primary source of income for her family, Shirin is involved in providing a public food service, having started this business in 2010.  Thanks to her hard work, her business, started with a sum of 50,000 som, now allows her to have a profit of 20,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Shirin requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy a refrigerator for cold beverages and ice-cream.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children, all attending school. She operates a bodaboda (motorcycle) in her rural area. She dreams of buying a passenger vehicle in future. Saumu lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Other sources of income include earnings from her husband, who is a businessman. She joined Yehu to access cheap loans, and she describes food and school fees as her greatest monthly expense.

With the KES 15,000, she intends to service her motorcycle and buy spare parts.

loans.use: to service her motorcycle and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Erik Gonzalo

texts.es: Erik es un joven estudiante de la carrera Ingenieria Civil, cursa el quinto año de su carrera, y el crédito lo solicita para pagar el curso de titulación que le permita finalizar sus estudios. Su mayor sueño en la vida es llegar a ser un profesional de éxito capaz y competente. Después de graduarse quiere estudiar un postgrado en estructuras. Su familia le inspira a trabajar y lograr sus metas, porque desea darles todo lo que pueda a nivel económico.
texts.en: Erik is a young student who is earning a degree in Civil Engineering.  He is currently in his fifth year of working toward his degree.  The loan he is requesting will pay for a required course that will enable him earn his degree.  His greatest wish in life is to become a successful, capable, and competent professional.  After graduation, he wants to pursue post-graduate study in framework.  His family inspires him to work and achieve his goals because they have given everything he needs so that he can achieve financial standing.

loans.use: to pay for a required course for his degree.

loans.name: Tamaris Lissethe

texts.es: Tamaris estudia la carrera de Administración de Empresas, solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera.  Dentro de algunos años se ve creando su empresa o trabajando para una institución del estado. Sus padres son su mayor inspiración, porque quiere sacar adelante a su familia, también desea darle trabajo a otras personas. Al estar en una institución sería responsable, con calidez humana.
texts.en: Tamaris is studying Business Administration and is asking for the loan to pay the final fees to get her diploma in her career.  She sees herself in a few years crating her own firm or working for a state institution.  Her parents are her greatest inspiration because she wants to move her family forward as well as provide employment for others.  She would be responsible and practice human kindness if she were employed in an institution.

loans.use: to pay final university fees.
